r7brBv1Rk5cQwv7MUhxYNQ.text: Great restaurant everyone  we come to Vegas we stop and get the food . Nachos are great and even great for sharing

xbpDHPm4besHi-fauAo1ww.text: Good- not great.  Good place to keep the buzz going.  Cheese nachos were the best.  The scorpion shots-meh Certainly better then most other Fremont options.

68syG-nrtHUbfVGS9-_V1g.text: Nice location in Downtown. Had buffalo chicken nachos and everything nachos . Enjoyed the atmosphere but the food was just ok. For Nachos

-fU6k9lw9WV91uWhduTbTA.text: This would have been a great experience except their service sucks.  Wanting to show my kids around since they over 21. Waiting for service  like morons standing there not one of their servers I saw 4 and 2 bartenders even acknowledge us.  For nachos not worth it go to the strip location.  Would have given them zero stars but I can't.   Restaurants come and go in Vegas because there are so many choices. They should treat every patron with exceptional  service.

vNOhPneHLCUTf22vssexOQ.text: Vegan nachos oh my god!!!!!!! Can't believe how amazing these were! So many vegan options! So happy we found this place! My boyfriend had the vegan spicy burrito and that was delicious as well. Would definitely come back here if I am in Vegas again!

b7-PdVIKkckcyIPp7KcUog.text: The Thai nachos were fabulous and Jovanny is the absolute best!!! A must stop when you visit Freemont Experience!

OkLBgF0pLCBsrYJZNa03kA.text: I love Nacho Daddy. I really do. The food are large portions especially for someone who would never get full off of nachos lol. The nacho sampler is simply divine. Queso, Salsa and guacamole for the win! I usually get the fiesta nachos although it was a little heavier on the redress beans so will omit them next time. Parking is easy downtown but beware your time limits for upcharges. The restaurant is around the alley and is an eye sore but worth it. Lost a star for service although my waiter was great. The appetizer came after the meal. The host quoted us 5 min to clean off a table. 15 minutes later she comes back from her "break?" and seats us in the same open table we saw walking in. While waiting, waiters walked passed us back and forth without uttering a hello. Finally the woman bartender was friendly enough to see that we were still awaiting seating. (Not crowded @ 6pm). Will return but def would prefer more courtesies in the service.

1Dt2Mhz-ln3kqTOaIXDU-w.text: This is a fun place to go. The service was excellent and staff was friendly. This place is the king of Nachos in Las Vegas they have over 6 different types on the menu. I had the shrimp nachos with spinach chips it's was so good a total different way to make nachos.

5qr1e6affSMOq-ALSyLnuQ.text: We visited Nacho Daddy for lunch today and it was super tasty! Was it the best nachos I've ever had? No. were they tasty? Yes! Ultimately the price was right and it was good, but nothing to write home about.

e2nLloCvvsuFOQ79a3j7gQ.text: Great meal just what you would want in a Mexican food place. I'm a nacho lover and they had a whole page of nachos to chose from. Definitely go here if you are craving some Mexican and they also have a location on the strip as well.

WzcoNaH8ffsR9iqab1iR4A.text: Wanted to find some amazing Mexican food and some were either overcrowded or couldn't find what we wanted (homemade quac) so we found this place not knowing what we were in store for. This place has an amazing Mexican flavor with the food and the environment. Very nice to see that when we sat down instant service, friendly and fast. The quest dip was unreal along with the spicy jalapeno cucumber margarita! I will definitely be coming back when we do Vegas again! A must eat!

YCeskbpXY2QsNOxQpnni7Q.text: Had the pork enchiladas. Pretty good. Curiously no chips and salsa offered before the main course. Tue free margarita with Yelp was a plus. Service is meh.

JyOTITMV9RTjBNZGpMkSQw.text: Soooooooooo amazing! Delicious food. Incredible service. Amazing atmosphere. A must every time we come to Vegas!!!

eYXAvZ42QsflFSzQ2mKO7Q.text: Let me start off with how AMAZING the shrimp nachos are, best part of the meal/experience  The staff? Bartenders, not so friendly, we felt ignore for majority of our experience. They got us drinks & our food order but then.. Nothing.. I work in restaurants, I hate when people have to flag me down.  We started with the amazing spicy shrimp nachos, hands down some of the best nachos I've ever had, piping hot & full of flavor   Then.. We waited..   Ignored by the guy bartender while the girl bartender ate food in plain sight. I understand you have to eat but in front of customers?  We continued to wait.. With empty waters (we were having cocktails too)   When we received our fajitas, they were cold. I shouldn't be able to touch the cast iron they're served on. I had to be that person to flag the one bartender down, not sure of his name, he had a small curly rat tail hairstyle. I told him they were cold, he looked surprised, they weren't sizzling like fajitas should be, so he took them back. They brought out what I assume we're the same fajitas just reheated somehow. They were ridiculously greasy & lackluster.   The salsas served with the chips were delicious and spicy..  Highlights- shrimp nachos/chips & salsa  downfalls- bartenders, ignoring us/ cold fajitas   We are going to try a different location & see if it's better

fm4qgMd7O2parzyeUT4yUA.text: Fantastic service here. Our servers name was Mark, amazingly friendly guy. There menu has a little bit for everyone. Me being vegan they had a whole portion of the menu dedicated to Vegans super stoked about that. The food was fantastic, there was a live singer who really lit up the room and the service was timely and enjoyable. Kudos

RvZacdThlwVCzlKcX9w_fg.text: So let me start by saying I LOVE Nacho Daddy. It is my first and last stop of every trip to Vegas. I feel like a regular even though I live hours away...The supreme tacos are the best thing about Nacho Daddy aside from the margaritas, even though they are called Nacho Daddy. I went today as my first stop to Vegas and ordered nachos. We asked for some extra cheese sauce, and after waiting awhile never received it. The waiter continuously checked on us, and at the end the manager took our whole nacho order off the bill. It was such wonderful customer service and after already loving this place, I can only say this MUST be a stop for everyone in Vegas. Love love love this place!!

sUyGVCOQ0t8IdvYQcVQ2CQ.text: Excellent food and service! Was so good we went back for more the very next day. Reasonable prices (especially for Vegas). Looks a little scary on the outside but don't be intimidated. Good people!

8JwqclX3L1jsbfY8n3Pvww.text: Overpriced 17.00 for a smothered burrito?? Slow service. Would probably not come back again unless on a Groupon lol

cnyd9CC4iWUHIyjtg7mPrw.text: The biggest waste of money.   Had been hearing about this place for a while and finally gave it a try on this past Friday (9/4).   We got the buffalo chicken nachos.   Mostly covered in ranch or blue cheese dressing, we are not sure which.   Service was slow, atmosphere was nothing to brag about and food was awful.    They state they make the chips, they must make them weeks before.  Ours were incredibly stale.      Won't got back any time soon, the pear margarita was ok.   However, there are plenty of other bars to drink at with much better food for the price.    I can't even give this place one star, however it made me in order to post this

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mostly the mystery white sauce.   Ranch or blue cheese?    You decide

-ZWBu63ZaQMLjw4lu5sliw.text: Enchilada Nachos were the bomb!!! We got half red half green sauce and they were huge and super tasty. The Margarita's needed some extra oomph...great service!!!

NNNnVzaGXRrW_YTZ9OnsSw.text: Buffalo Chicken Nachos.  That's pretty much all you need, really.  Go ahead, I'll wait for you to order and finish.  ....  SEE?!?  Weren't those things awesome?  In any case, I am a fan of that particular selection, although their burger nachos and chicken fried steak/egg breakfast nachos are no slouch either.  A decent little location just across the way from the Neonopolis, and nestled well within Fremont Street, I liked the low-key vibe there, with their poppy music videos on the TV, and a pretty tasty Bloody Mary (also of note, their coffee selection is excellent).  The service is friendly and keeps tabs on you.  Prices are reasonable, and portions are BIG.  Come hungry, for they will hook you up if you are suffering any sort of nacho deficiency.    In any case, I took it upon myself to visit this location four times over two weeks, if that tells you anything, and now that I'm thinking on it, some buffalo chicken nachos do sound remarkable tasty right about now.  They need delivery.  Because as strong as my need for nachos is, I'm not feeling the cold right now.  We need to work this out, Nacho Daddy....

cwxxW6cLlzUzHq0Nc0VYLg.text: OMG! THIS PLACE IS AWESOME! I had the thai nachos and my man had the sloppy joe nachos and they both were delicious. I was so surprised how good they both were. I love great food on vacation besides steakhouses.

HZ0TZcSA1INugRuigbIpPA.text: Tasty nachos! Super tasty! We had the burger based nachos and they were great! Also had a chicken taco, also great! Feels like a bar from home immediately.

WzqgBP058URRXE4vwRpiuw.text: This place is on point. BBQ pork nachos were amazing plus I got my free Margarita, so worth it! Recommend this place to everyone and I will be back! And thanks you our server Mark, you rock!

-yFhqC82UKgO8RdMSx_29w.text: My husband and I stopped in on Thursday night at around 7:30p. We were staying at the D so my dad recommended this place to us.   It was a short walk from the D. When we got there, there wasn't too many people inside. We wanted to watch the TVs so we decided to eat at the bar. The bartender was very nice (I don't remember her name) and the bar was very clean. My husband ordered a beer and I had a Daddy's Michelada which was really good. I also ordered some mojo pork street tacos and my husband ordered the wings. He said the wings were good and my tacos were good but not great. I've had way better tacos in California so my standards are pretty high. Maybe I should have ordered Nachos since that is what they are known for. Overall it was a good experience and I would go again. If my tacos were amazing I would have given it 5 stars.

WutpFRqouFDodq5z8i6neg.text: I recently was at Nacho Daddy and ordered the taco plate.  It came with 3 tacos that were so good! I also ordered a Jalapeno margarita that was so good too! The nachos looked delicious! The waiter was super friendly and offered good advice as to what to order! Don't miss this place while you're in the Fremont area!

YFOOL64-EiZlypnth7c3kg.text: Hands down, this is my favorite place to have lunch while visiting Vegas! The Asian chicken nachos are always sweet and flavorful and the Bloody Mary is the best that I have found anywhere! We've visiting the Downtown and the Strip locations and neither disappoint. Such a fun place to eat, drink and hang out.

zOzNz4-I2L88FrkBp07mAg.text: Ever since eating at this downtown Las Vegas spot, I've had a recurring dream where I'm in the middle of a big plate of nachos ready to be devoured by giant versions of my friends a la Honey I Shrunk the Kids. And no, it is not a nightmare, because the nachos here are so good I can't think of a better place to perish than in the gooey goodness of a soggy, cheese-smothered tortilla chip from Nacho Daddy.  Before you ready any further, take a moment to appreciate the pun of the name.  ...It took me a while at first, so just want to make sure we're all on the same page.  BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS. BREAKFAST NACHOS.  So the chicken fried steak breakfast nachos are in my top ten favorite dishes of all time. I was even inspired to make a version for my friends on a few occasions to great success, but I haven't come close to beating the original.  The one drawback to this place is the service. When we did get service it was great, but the waitstaff/bartenders were spread thin and trips to our table were few and far between.  Even so, you neeeeeed to go here if you find yourself in downtown vegas. Back to dreaming about the next time I get to visit here.

c6Wkuxou0EbP8UR8MU3LDQ.text: This experience wasn't bad, but it definitely could have been better.  My wife and I were going to a concert nearby and wanted to grab a bite to eat before the show. She was in the mood for nachos, so coming here was a no-brainer.   Upon entering, we were thrown off by having to seat ourselves. It was kind of packed, so finding a table in the back took a minute. There was a large party in the center that seemed to be taking up everyone's attention, so it was about 5 minutes before we even got menus and another 5 before we got to speak with our server.  Fortunately, that gave us time to decide what we wanted to order, so we ordered as soon as he arrived.   It took nearly 45 minutes to get our food, but again, that was due to the large party in the center. The food was fresh when it arrived, but was mediocre at best.   Her nachos were over-saturated with this extremely spicy salsa. The amount of cheese on the nachos gave the impression that ANY cheese on there was merely an accident. It was primarily a plate of chips and salsa, garnished with chicken and a few vegetables.    I ordered the fish and chips. The fish was amazing. The fries were great while they were piping hot. However, as soon as they cooled down, they became hard as a rock and hazardous to my health. I couldn't finish even half of them (and there weren't a lot to begin with).   The part that gives this experience 3 stars (and not 1 or 2, as the food was quite a disappointment) was the service. Our server was Danny, and the little amount of service the party in the center allowed him to give us was excellent.   Overall, it was a decent experience. Not one I intend to repeat any time soon, though.

rLV2Q7hKMsNEslsLUFWDqA.text: Great vibes,  great food. Definitely coming back. Thank you Giustina for the amazing service.

BL5AHJsOmVkD-wBK7_Teqg.text: Great fresh ingredients! Love the kale salad and the trio chip thingy with the queso :) our server "ally" was the best server I have ever had in Vegas hands down! Great place!

8OzxMEeXgPISXWCCyIqAPg.text: Service was amazing. Will definitely return! Nachos are amazing, definitely recommend the supreme tostada nachos. They are delicious!

jo2Jyk-B_6aC4UqnWHLGAQ.text: BEST FOOD I HAD MY WHOLE TRIP!!! we went down town to gamble and decided we needed to eat before getting on the bus back to the strip and saw this place out of the corner of our eyes. And I'm glad we did!!! The service was great it was after 2am on Saturday night and everyone was great. We had chicken enchiladas, queso dip with tortillas and a huge burrito and everything was amazing! We will for sure go back next time we are in Vegas and will make sure we tell all our friends to stop by when they are there!!! Thank you!!!

h4O_8ZnQN2QaCzbbbNgoIg.text: Really expensive. Staff not restaurant trained. like a take out style Super low key

ki3lDZbnUH7DfTSHXzRJeQ.text: First time here when visiting Vegas. Had seen the restaurant on t.v. and knew we had to try it. Started with a white peach margaritas that, although sweet, was so good I ended up having three!  For a shared appetizer, the hubs and I thoroughly enjoyed a plate of pulled pork nachos.  Griffin, our excellent waiter, said he'd get the bbq sauce on the side because the kitchen can sometimes be heavy-handed with it, which was perfect, as my husband and I have differing levels of love for it. The nachos were spot on. So good that I nearly ordered a second variety as my entree!  Wayne ate fajita cheese steak with parmesan garlic fries. I had fajita chimichanga with green sauce. Both were outstanding.  We will be making Nacho Daddy's a regular stop on our annual trip out here from now on.

ACz3ULtPHj_yNmXmOvl-hQ.text: I am so very impressed with the service I reviewed at Nacho's.  The food was good, but the bar staff/servers (Anya was ours) is what made the experience memorable. My husband and I visit Vegas often and going forward the service that we received will bring us back to Nacho Daddy's every time. Make this a place to stop on your list of things to do in Vegas! And ask for Anya she will not disappoint you in her attitude and ability to fix any issues with food, atmosphere, and of course having a great time!

bMN1nGyUorc2uBp9ajTjiw.text: Recently visited the downtown location, i was pretty impressed by the entire staff! They were all so friendly and helpful! Anya took very good care of us answering all of our obnoxious questions! The nachos were fantastic!

P0L7XZ0wJhzI-XN53UKLXg.text: Slow braised pork tacos are a MUST! Nachos are huge portions, so be ready to get stuffed! Margaritas were pretty great too :)

ZmJvwopbqv47e1grFdnmiw.text: Breakfast in Las Vegas is a favorite thing for us to do.   The Anaheim taco served at Nacho Daddy is the ultimate breakfast treat.  Loved it.

duddeLO6xyQWGcgH8A2C2w.text: My wife and I saw this on Yelp and took a cab to it ...it's just off Fremont the price was descent we had nachos and wings along with margs nachos were some of the best we have had yumm my wife loves the wings (me too)

Ldy1bh17ITL0tCNCJR3uYQ.text: Nacho daddy...more like nacho crappy. The bar b q chicken nachos didnt taste right and for a place that prides themselves on nachos the portion of nachos was pretty weak. Im still hungry. Help! Hungry!

OKg6pEgCbv0y7cL7Eb8vBA.text: I have frequented this place many times and have never had a bad meal. I absolutely LOVE , LOVE there Steak Supreme Tacos . First off all they start with a homemade flour tortilla that is lightly grilled to perfection , they proceed to stuff it full with juicy marinated steak , mozzarella cheese , roasted anaheim salsa and then top it off with cilantro , it also comes with refried beans and Mexican rice . This Supreme Taco is very moist and sooooo amazing . It's definitely my favorite menu item . I've also had the Seasoned Ribeye , and OH MY GOD , it was perfectly seasoned and so tender that it melted in my mouth . They are not a steak house so I was surprised as to how delicious the Ribeye was . I'm going to say its one of the best I've ever had here in Las Vegas .  The local vibe here is great and the service was perfectly on key . My drink is always kept full and the staff is very personable . You must come by and try this place out !!

2eR02EJhwQLn2jdud1Q_Gw.text: Great place. Came upon it by accident. Stopped by with a bachelor party. Stayed for like 3 hours. Courtney was great. Had a lot of drinks.  Great chips and salsa and wings. We will be back.

D7UBB6EivocKZykuOlliWg.text: Since it was my birthday, I went in for the breakfast nachos which were unbelieveable!  Tender chicken fried steak strips with fluffy scrambled eggs and country gravy.  The wait staff, I believe it was Ally and Courtney, were so friendly and on top of making sure I was happy.  They gave me a sample breakfast taco with avacado, I'll order that next time.  I highly recommend as the food was excellent, the service was fantastic and the place has a real beach resort feel to it that reminds me of Hawaii or San Diego.  My new 2nd home.

L9FwWS3qvvDDra_QH4RraA.text: I have lived in downtown for a little over 5 months and finally tried it!  They have great menu and services are great!  You will have to pay for parking and sometime hard to find parking.  Other than that I do recommend this place!

B95NQhQg714o-FiQW4LEtw.text: I swear to god the shrimp tacos will be the best things you ever eat in your entire life. They have prompted me with menus before, to no avail of course. My savory mouth is drenched via saliva due to the fact that I know after the first bite of these, delicious, wonderful, out of this world, outstanding, beautiful little things they call shrimp tacos hit my taste buds, game over. I could eat these things for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and when I happen to wake up at midnight and I'm looking for a snack. Not to mention the astounding amount of knowledge of their liqueurs, can't say I have a negative thing so say about this place. Don't get me wrong, they get huge groups which could make the wait times a little long, we're all human and can accept that. Hands down my favorite place to gorge myself and consume booze downtown. Always 5 stars, service and food alike. Ally was wonderful and very attentive!

BqlNRgVoDreNo56UxDWcKA.text: I am always on freemont street for vacation and wanted to try something other than the hotel restaurant or Denny's. This place is so good it's crazy! I got the BBQ chicken nachos, and OMG! They said they were spicy, and yup! They were spicy! Didn't disappoint at all. Chicken, celery, buffalo sauce. And it's a big portion so I was totally stoked. My boyfriend got the BBQ chicken nachos and those were almost better! Chicken, beans, corn, pico. So great! And the customer service is great! Our server made sure we had everything we needed at all times. I will definitely be coming  here again and would recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

Cjt1m8HAIZoWE9U1F6sjqg.text: The food is about Del Taco quality and the menu is all over the place and I get the feel this is a restaurant without direction.  Hopefully a decent restaurant will move into this space.

bvAFhTildA8z9CUSpQAjSA.text: I come here at least once a week. Im usually here for lunch and its never too busy which I like. Not sure what its like at night. The food is good and the staff is great! I haven't sat at the bar yet, again, I'm only there for lunch but it looks big and fully stocked!

rQxoF3VaLSLRoo96R4jxQw.text: Today I dined at the Nacho Daddy right off Fremont street. And I must say it was more than exceptional.  Food is more than a fair price, happy hour almost every day of the week.(3-6) and on top of that its VERY good and original, you won't find the same exact recipes elsewhere. Only problem you might have is the waiting time. People are usually rushing through while in Vegas so I understand why that could be a problem for some people  Lastly, there was a man best up across the street and the staff quickly checked on him and called the ambulance. Something they did not have to do.   Try it yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just the bar.

wZQHAiX0K8H04iwQaF9sEA.text: Love this place. Service has always been great and super-kid-friendly. Check in here on yelp and the house margarita is complimentary. Kids love the chicken quesadillas and enchiladas. Mom and dad love the street tacos and of course any of the nachos are fantastic. Heads up: Heavy chopped onion garnish, so if you don't like too many onions, make note. Great location between Planet Hollywood and the Marriott Grand Chateau. Recommend for families. Great time!

C51H3s2dkpb2gSyWm5V86A.text: Loved the cheese dip, but $50 for a margarita pitcher is a bit much.  It was good, but that's way too much for an off the strip restaurant.   We also had the sloppy joe nachos. They were tasty.   The restaurant was packed so we were happy overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Pina Margarita....its a must try

YhwxMDPq9sPcVZHjgOmsNw.text: This is a nice little place for some late night munchies. Small and tight space but the food makes up for it. Try the Thai Nachos.  It will trick your taste buds!

IvHsMKiRWnbPEDlrGbHsGA.text: Came looking for some good food and found this place off of Fremont Street.  Lots of traditional Mexican fare and some vegan options too! Drinks were well made and the food was excellent.  Joseph and Justin were top notch! We will be back!

j2v3WVQwbnN73mrYGkKqgA.text: Split the filet mignon nachos and the corn not on the cob. Free margarita with Yelp check in. The corn was great. The nachos were large enough to share and fully loaded. Meat was tender and plentiful. Chips stayed crispy throughout.

cQWe22g7qxZb5YkxRbQ36A.text: Today, was our first time at Nacho Daddy. Everything seemed fine. Food was amazing and drink were bomb.com! The only downside to this visit was the restrooms they were disgusting and dirty! If that's how they have the restrooms just imagine how they have the kitchen. Changing Table had poop all over!!!!!!It was so gross!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yJMWIjPQgPSxdzvETG8IRA.text: I love this place.  The atmosphere is super chill, the staff is attentive and friendly. My favorite is the hostess Kylie, she's so sweet.   I had the four cheese nachos and two micheladas. Both were so flavorful, so delicious.   The only thing I don't like about this place is that there isn't one in California.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pacifico Michelada
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Four cheese nachos, so bomb.

hnZqaC-CR9eLJoBAXvWSsw.text: Wow! The Mexican candy margarita is so delicious. Amazing service! The waiter's energy was infectious, the vegan menu is fantastic and great vibes and energy all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4MYCbAu0DhKdW__gska3tg.text: The food was good enough (we all had nachos). My hubby got the Golden Knights nachos, which were19.95, and said there was a small amount of steak on them- definitely NOT worth the price.  The enchilada nachos, and fiesta nachos had a ton of chicken on them. Our main problem was the service. It was almost as if our server was high. We had to ask for water and lemonade for half of our party 3 times,  and waited about 20 minutes for it. She brought 2 waters out for my hubs and I (we got there first)  and forgot to put ice in ONE of them She checked on us once during the meal,  and we had to flag someone down for the check.  Then they gave us our check AND someone else's.  It wasn't extraordinarily busy, so I'm not sure what the problem was.  Overall,  I probably won't rush to go back.  Kind of overpriced for decent (not great) food, and bad service.  If we do go again,  it will be a different location!

gtdjyUGNTbWgeio2Jh08Kg.text: This place is amazing! The service is great, the food is incredible and the chips and salsa are to die for! Will definitely be back

uVLU1g5BirNuYUeI8aNafA.text: Best nachos we've ever had. We substituted items, added some, and put some things one the side. We customized the best nachos ever ! Our server Marc was awesome, he was helpful, funny and sweet.

OUq6h59VKLTQsbGDioDEcw.text: Hands down one of the best experiences in Las Vegas !! My boyfriend and I google a place to eat when we landed and that was the first to pop up, you will not be disappointed ! A must when in Vegas, and you need to take a scorpion shot ! The staff was extremely nice ! Very helpful on what to order.

iSDltlb7cTey6GdbLoIVGQ.text: *military discount*  What do you call cheese that isn't your's?  Nacho cheese!  *ba-dum-tissss* Thanks folks, I'll be here all week.    After sampling some of their delicious bbq nachos at the last yelp event, I was eager to go here.  I finally got my chance yesterday 11-15-15 at 11:30 AM.  This restaurant is located on 4th street which is right smack dab in the middle of the fremont street madness.  We parked in the fremont parking garage and it cost $2.    $35.74 got me a bloody mary, a triple dip appetizer, and a barbecue pulled pork sandwich.  Our server, Jon, was very attentive and brought us a high chair, crayons, and a kids menu for the boy.    The bloody mary experience was unique to me....it was a bloody mary DIY bar.  For $8 they give you a mason jar with ice and Absolut in it, and then you go up to the bar and make it the way you want it.  They had bloody mary mix, pickles, celery, hot sauces, cucumbers, olives, lemons, etc. I thought that was pretty neat.    The triple dip ($11.95) consisted of white queso dip, guac, and salsa, and it came with the world's saltiest chips (see photo).  That queso dip....oh wow....I wish I could fill up a jacuzzi with it and drink my way out.  It was heavenly.  Their guac, however, was yucky.  It tasted like the kind you can buy at Wal-mart.  I would have given this place 5 stars if their guac was good and I didn't have to wade through smelly street performers to get there.    The pulled pork sandwich was awesome...so juicy and messy!  It came with piping hot fries that I really enjoyed dipping in the queso dip.  My only critique would be that the pork was in large chunks and I prefer it more shredded.    Yay! I'm a fan.  Next time I'm getting the buffalo nachos and street corn.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $12 sloppy jose nachos. 4-2-16
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $8.25 for 6 of the tiniest boneless wings. 4-2-16
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6.35 mexican corn. I just paid over 6 dollars for one ear of corn.  4-2-16

Rs2TkjxsbRXmzkFdjSR69Q.text: The food is excellent, but the service was absolutely terrible. We came in on a Sunday, ordered nachos and waited an hour plus for them to be ready--I'm pretty sure our bartender, Taeilor, forgot to ring them in. No one even apologized for the wait. Usually, being in the food industry myself, I'm very understanding of busy shifts, but this was ridiculous. I understand that she was busy for a Sunday football shift, but her attitude was unwarranted. Highly suggest the food, maybe we just came on the wrong day? Hopefully she can pick it up next time.

7N9prs-bdN5LbRVlm7iVwA.text: I ordered takeout. Guy on the phone was friendly and accommodating while I placed my order. He gladly answered the questions I had about the menu. When I got to the restaurant to pick up my order, I was not greeted by the woman at the register. Instead, I was stared at without a word. She then decided to talk to her coworker instead of help me.  Food was okay. Didn't live up to the hype. I got the queso dip which was the only good thing about this entire food experience. Maybe skip this place if you want authentic Mexican food.

EYtOmwIqZ0nGNo1yfgB3QA.text: I was highly sceptical of this place but my boyfriend and his cousin were raving about this place so I decided to give it try. The food and drinks were definitely up to pair however, the service of our waiter was awful. Food and drinks alone five stars, but our bartender and server were 3. Overall would recommend

Q74qjtJcIUhZKS8HGH2BoQ.text: Loved the Filet Mignon Nachos and Cadillac Margarita! Cool bartenders and fun atmosphere too.

6nSch_besQREZ5YZJn97pQ.text: Jovanny was amazing. Such a great server! We had a great experience with a large group.  On the food side, the enchiladas and queso are delicious. No one had a complaint.

0lLvQ5cB3ZzIW3lBcCJyaQ.text: Cool industrial grungy interior, friendly service, and a vast variety of nachos. We settled on filet mignon nachos and they were tasty and perfect for Super Bowl Sunday!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon nachos on Super Bowl Sunday!

34nyeK4391hL7TZqkw1grQ.text: Wow.  I had the best vegan nachos ever. Like ever.  And ive had em all over thr country for the past twenty years.  Flavorful delicious.  Ugly green chips but who cares.  So fukkn good.  Miserable server did a shot with us then charged us for her shot.  Then didn't come to pick up the check. Left a zero tip for the first time in three years.

_3l82NniIqssGKxHqtbQjA.text: Audre was our server. She is quick and attentive.   Dunks and food came quick.  Nachos are delicious and drinks are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ke2dzEY-e0InJ1bzicRgrg.text: Love this place. The options are great, they even have vegan meals, their margaritas are delicious also. If you're looking for a quite place this isn't it, but if you're looking for yummy food this is the spot.

xXxPieuS3NxWPPyGWOmRHA.text: The food was great, the service was to amazing, drinks even better. So I suppose you're wondering why I'm giving 2 stars? The poor staff is stretched so damn thin there it's disgusting. My friend and I went many times when we were there because of their vegan menu. It was tough a couple of times service wise. But one time our waitress (who was such a sweetheart! I don't remember her name but she was a lovely, thin yoga teaching girl) was trying so hard to make sure we got our food and drink in a timely matter. The bartender was too busy not paying attention to the orders, and then they ran out of margarita stuff! We were there for punk rock bowling, and I guess the manager (who you could tell was there wearing some hideous lilac colored shirt, really dude?), was too busy sitting on his phone to notice his staff was running around trying to do the work of 5 people per person.   Long story short, food is awesome, drinks... awesome. The waitstaff, fantastic. But man, I hope they're more prepared next year so I don't have to wait 30 minutes for my food and or margarita.

LlBKGwKeLCPSUIb8tiiVWQ.text: This place was pretty good. Actually the best part about it was the staff. They are VERY enthusiastic about what's going on, and very attentive to what you need.   I had the nachos and a taco. Let's start with the nachos:  The only reason I cant give this place 5 stars is because there are a LOT of bare chips on the pile of nachos they bring you. In fact, when I received it I was quite surprised to discover how many NOT covered chips there were. They could have done away with about two thirds of the chips, but they basically use the chips as a way to present you with a pile high plate, even though the good stuff is not as plentiful as it could have been. Still delicious. Just not as "Oh my God" as I was lead to believe.  Now for the taco: I had the barbacoa taco - Now this deserves the "OH MY GOD!!" It was DELICIOUS!! In fact, I wish I had ordered a couple more and NOT gotten the nachos. The meat was seasoned PERFECTLY!! And the tortilla was a thick one, that had been slightly grilled and delicious.  A good time was had and it was a really fun place right off of Freemont street.

X_fFSaMP4LLpZPo2FRg8xg.text: COME TO THIS RESTAURANT IF YOU ARE EVER WANDERING THE DOWNTOWN AREA!! It was the PERFECT meal to take a break from the dancing, singing, wandering and ziplining. (Or whatever you do downtown) I'm a vegetarian, and I don't usually have a problem finding something at a mexican place, but they even had an extensive VEGAN menu! Whoa.  Our server, Luis, was a rockstar. He made us feel at home in a strange city, and managed to get food out to all of his tables quickly while still having time to chat and get to know us. His margarita suggestion was taken, and enjoyed. My spicy vegan burrito was one of the best burritos I have ever eaten.  We loved this place so much, we went back the next day! Luis was our server again, the food was amazing again, and the equally awesome manager, Tyler, even gave us a yummy churro sunday on the house! At that point I just wanted to move in. I don't throw 5 star reviews around willy nilly, but they deserve it. I can't think of any reason a person should not come here. I will be returning to their restaurant for every Vegas visit from now on.

SuJ2pCryjkIeMBNFqmnkLA.text: We had our wedding reception here! Best idea EVER!!! The manager Brian Peede was kind, full of enthusiasm and a cool guy! Our waiter, Jovanni, was hilarious and made us feel at home! We will be back when we visit Vegas again 100%

stQkKBnS79wKbk8hWLH_pw.text: Myself and my boyfriend spotted this place as we were wondering a long the strip Thanksgiving afternoon. As two Brits we really just wanted a chilled out place with fairly good food and drinks. We got far more than we expected. Heather was so welcoming and fun! She went above and beyond. I actually can't wait to come back here on my next Vegas trip. My advice, avoid the over priced tourist traps and head here!

eciUUy9UZLftESZ19282-w.text: This place is located in the tourist hub of downtown. This usually means the food ain't that great. This one continues to keep the bad food tradition alive. It was late, we were hungry. The place was pretty empty. The food was loaded with msg and made me sick for days. I had the so called homemade guac.....wasn't the freshest. I ordered the wild rice which seems to have come from a box and loaded with msg. Had the server to remove it from the check as I did not eat it after examining it. The black beans were good. Again, it seems msg is what gives this food any kind of flavor. My companion had the queso served with chips and a heat lamp and ground beef. She said it was ok if you were intoxicated.The brighter side is our server. He was amazing! Very attentive and fast. Took care of things as needed very quickly and with a smile.  Another plus is  the branding and the merchandising.  I love good marketing, but let's back it up with a good food product.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool gear!!
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K4X8ev6yPyitC5KtJ6ASRQ.text: Amazing food! We got the pork tacos and the Nacho Daddy Average Nachos. Both have great flavors and huge servings. Our service was amazing, the bathrooms are clean and well kept.

5lie78OTE7Fu4Zr5BghVTw.text: Perfect! I've been here twice now, and I'm sad that it hasn't been more. I'm too busy running my own restaurant, but I'm glad when I come here.  First, I was greeted promptly and with a smile. Next, I was welcomed by the manager with fresh chips and roasted salsa. The margaritas were strong and tasty! The Mahi Mahi tacos were filled with fish and slaw and I barely got to the to rice and beans. ( which were fresh and hot)  Check and exit greeting were on point and I could not have left more satisfied and pleased. Congrats Nacho Daddy! Well done!

ufzzT_-IMFS4bKWaVVTgUw.text: Margaritas are on point and the enchilada nachos are hitting the spot. I was a little worried about the service when we walked in. Last time I ended up walking out but our waiter Aerrick is fantastic!!  I will definitely come back and sit in his section.

267rQXXOjyYxyfJxbZcKoA.text: 4 of us dined here on March 1st. We had a blast! All of the diners (including us) were singing along (loud, proud, and off-key) to the 80's & 90's music videos playing on the big screens. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The food and drinks are worth way more than the price said everyone at the table. I only snacked there while my friends / family ate full meals. The following are items I sampled:  Daddy's Chip Plate - The salsa, guacamole, and queso were perfectly seasoned.  Daddy's Buffalo Wings - May I have these every Sunday?  Tortilla Soup - This is the only dish I was not a fan of. It wasn't bad. I just prefer my torilla soup on the thinner brothy side.  A delicious mango alcoholic beverage - Yum, Yum, and more Yum.

Z53vTWdYtEhwFmBYc6nIbw.text: After hearing they had some of the best nachos around, I knew my boyfriend and I had to stop here for dinner. We are nacho fiends!! We went around 8 at night. There was a good crowd but it was not too crazy. The service was not the greatest. It was incredibly difficult to find our waitress and order food. Once we finally did, it took 35 minutes to receive our food! We ordered the queso dip (which we asked to be brought before everything considering it is an appetizer), but it came with everything at the same time. Also, the three tables that were seated at least 15 minutes after us received their food far earlier than we did, which did not make sense. The queso was good, but only when it was hot. After that it had some sort of funky after taste. The kale salad was incredibly bland and disappointing. The fiesta nachos were okay but not anything close to what I expected them to be. Overall, we left nacho daddy with queasy stomachs and had to end our night there. Definitely not how you want to spend Vegas.

yMDu4aaLtDNgvxfDaCW42w.text: Hit the spot for us after walking down Fremont Street in the heat. Kathy had a salad and we split the fiesta nachos. They were great - had shredded chicken breast with just the right amount of guacamole. Checked in on Yelp for the free margarita and they let me upgrade to mango for a couple dollars. Friendly staff, from hostess to waiters. We enjoyed it.

DXUAX7i8M-tIexu0HOmygA.text: I came here while on vacation because the concept of the restaurant was great. That being said, the place needs a little more work communicating with each other. I was helped by a young lady and a trainee, but my combo order was still missing a few things.  I had ordered a second beer, but that didn't make an appearance until I was well over with my dinner. I would understand if it was busy, but that wasn't the case. The group of people next to my booth were having the same issues, and had even had their tray of food knocked over by a server. Communication is key. This place still gets kudos because I know the staff was putting in effort to make sure my visit was great.

e3OXwMnyKLUSVyWPtvx3oQ.text: Omg! I thought that there wouldn't be many options for me as a lactose intolerant person. The name makes you think there's only nachos. They offer great American appetizers like buffalo wings as well as wonderful Mexican fare such as nachos and burritos. I got the smothered chicken burrito with no dairy products and boy was I amazed. Large portion, quick delivery (even though there were 20 people in my party) and such great customer service! Definitely recommend!!!

9PEld4aBKfBjDlVMI2yU1A.text: excellent service all around espcially from brirtany she's the bomb best service and food I've had in a long time, highly recommended will be back for sure great quest and great Michelads.  highly recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_6JN6IlARrjEJ8VmpU6SQQ.text: 4 days ago I had a bad  experience at one of the locations so I reached out and I was quickly responded to by one of the managers name Angie she was very nice, very respectful  and I'm very grateful that she took the time and consideration to reach out to each to me to make sure she was aware  of what the problems  were.... . Thank you Angie .... I will just chock it up as everyone has a bad day and try again because  of how awsome  you are.

Wr1zp9812sPSxcp7lnGbeA.text: Great place to grab some beers and a big platter of nachos. Good for gobbling up yourself or sharing with a group of friends. Nachos are delish and finger licking good.  Also grab some street tacos off the appetizer menu. Small snack size tacos. Pick any meat to be served in two thin corn tortillas. The chicken meat was perfectly grilled and slightly burnt which gave the perfect amount of crunch. Yum!  This located is located a little turn off Fremont street. A great stop to cool off from the Vegas heat with some cocktails and munchies!!

gKMO0SicMYLYYjQrn3loLg.text: That's Nachos, that's mine!  After surveying the LONG line at our first choice restaurant (on our first night in Vegas), we nixed that idea and looked to the trusty Yelp app for another suggestion.  Thank goodness Nacho Daddy was open late that night to appease our hunger pains.  1.  Yes, they're open late!  Thank goodness.  We visited for late night dinner on 9/30/18 and I believe they were open till 200am.  Those looking for a late meal (like we were) will be rejoicing I'm sure.  2.  Yes, they do have nachos on the menu.....of course, that was practically a given.  To be brutally honest, the menu extended beyond the nachos section/list, but my friend and I didn't look elsewhere.  We came for nachos.  That's all.  We ended up ordering the Fajita nachos, which was the special that night.  The server was very accommodating when we asked to have all the spicy components of the dish served on the side.  The nachos was a very generous portion.  So, so good.   3.  Yes, do order a drink!  We ordered the Daddy Margarita, which happened to be a reduced price in conjunction with our Fajita nachos order.  $4 a glass versus $10.  Admittedly, the glass was enormous!  Omg. I was absolutely taken aback.  Thank goodness we weren't driving.  4.  Yes, the service was excellent!  Aside from the hostess who didn't seem to want to seat us (she strongly HINTED at the open seats at the bar), everyone we encountered at NDD provided exceptional customer service.  I wish I remembered the server's name because he was extremely friendly and polite.    BOTTOM LINE: Late hours.  Wonderful service.  Tasty nachos.  Good margaritas!  I will be back if I find myself in DTLV in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daddy Margarita
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zxxJpdZljzeKchMpVdWQcQ.text: Bad seating..rude people. If you dont have a party of 7 then you'll be sitting in a corner.

fqRMkaxTzsjZdNWwW2OmlQ.text: Overall, average Mexican food... nothing special. Wait time for the table was supposed to be 20 mins but we got seated within 5. However, we waited a very long time for a waiter to come by and take our order (20mins) then another 30-45 for our food. Loud ambiance. Read further for details.   They had a yelp deal where if you check in you get a free margarita which the waiter clarified as their house margarita and if you wanna upgrade you can minus the $8 (price of the house margarita) from whichever you choose and pay the difference. I chose the house margarita as the chimichanga was already $13 and it wasn't great, tasted like margarita mix poured into a glass, I would recommend trying one of the others if you do.   The nacho and chimichanga portions were quite large, even my friend who's near 200lbs and has a definite appetite couldn't finish the fiesta nachos. The other dishes were average sized.   The chimichanga was average nothing special, however I did like that the guac and sour cream wasn't just in a scoop it was spread along the chimichanga. But it also had a scoop or guac on top.   The ambiance is quite loud, but I guess what do you expect being in DTLV.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco and enchilada Signature Taco-Enchilada Combo
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fiesta Nacho

qX2wf9jw7TdmpiWhnY4fbA.text: Saw Nacho Daddy on a blog on Pinterest so I thought I would give it a try. Wasn't sure at first if we were going to stay but decided to. We sat down at a high table and it took about 5-10 minutes for someone to come over. Ordered the Supreme Tostada Nachos to split with my friend and it was pretty good.

QAIq44vssRwxeqSXbnDCNQ.text: I sat at the bar and used the Yelp check in to get a free house margarita with the purchase of an entree. I got the fajita burrito as an entree. The food and drink were just ok. The bar does give a great view of downtown Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajita Burrito

kl-1iLVXv-cxPIQuUrQ5vw.text: Perla was a FANTASTIC server! The food was amazing as were the Margaritas!  Good choice off the strip! A must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family and Food!

6lLojnKWazoaVbGl1DjloA.text: Delicious nachos! My husband and I split the barbecue pork nachos and they were amazing! My mom and step dad got the fajitas and they really enjoyed it. It's very nice and generous that they give you a free margarita with your yelp check in. This place is a great place to come for lunch or dinner. Portions are large so you could definitely split with someone and still be full. Location is convenient if you're by Fremont Street.

3LqFRyiqoFx3cHg_Q0BhlQ.text: Nice place with decent food , drinks and music.The servings are huge , me and friend shared the fiesta nachos with grilled chicken. Its only 5 minutes from Fremont street , so its convenient and yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican candy margarita

EVWR0WtbsODvJjdud5cWEA.text: BEST NACHOS ON EARTH!!! Literally every single time I'm in Las Vegas I make it a point to go to nacho daddy. Their nachos are deliciously amazing. Like every single chip is the perfect bite. They are so freakin good. I don't have a single complaint, and I've been to this location many times. Forgot the name of what we ordered last time but there's a pic!! Order any type of nachos I promise you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fV8Z-qF8cdppY8zNGV9QlA.text: The first time here and I knew it would be my favorite stop before heading down to the Fremont Experience.  My husband and I traveled with 2 other couples and we all agreed that STRONG Margaritas & Nachos would not disappoint. WE WERE RIGHT!  We couldn't bring our street drinks in but that's ok. Our server Rico took care of us right away and our margaritas were on the table right The nachos are better than you can imagine! You can't go wrong. In our party of 6 we all ordered something different to share and everything was amazing! You can't go wrong here... except don't bring your own drink in.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qT_85rQ9hY_9GWtinWaFtw.text: I Love Nacho Daddy. We go there every time we visit Vegas, which is a few times a year. On my last visit I had an unfortunate experience which left me with a bad feeling. Three of us were ordering the skinny margarita so we decided to get a pitcher. After pouring and tasting we noticed a bubbly in the drink. The skinny margarita simply lists tequila, lime juice, and agave. I was not happy. Brought it to the attention of the waitress who apologized profusely and brought a new pitcher. This pitcher only yielded four 8 oz. glasses with ice because the pitcher was filled to the top with ice. I felt duped and very upset. I did not complain again because we had brought newbies and I already felt bad for having talked up the place so much.  I was truly disappointed in my experience at Nacho Daddy.

BS43rduEbQshyyGhUFgdHw.text: Plan and Simple: It was amazing. Great nachos and a cool atmosphere. Very bar-like. Friendly and accommodating staff.

Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Knights Nachoes w/ substitutions

G_X8KrGs-By7pblky5wrng.text: So I came to Vegas from Vancouver BC and checked all reviews before I decided where I was gonna eat. This place by far exceeded my expectations and the reviews All you can eat chips and salsa for$3.75 and the salsa is crazy good Ordered the Chicken Enchiladas super flavourful and so FILLING. If you get a chance this is a must stop and enjoy this place as well as the margaritas. Thank you for the amazing food and atmosphere

y7SkgukVaXMpdp-4OZ_1SQ.text: LOVE the food here, and the atmosphere and service are fantastic too. Margaritas were tasty and the happy hour deal put them at $5 each. What I loved most were the various vegan options - I loved the loaded vegan nachos, and vegan avocado tacos. The avocados were beer battered and fried, and there was already some heat/spice in the tacos! I also tried a bit of the vegan chick'n fajitas, which were great, but I was so full by that point that we couldn't finish that dish. The portion sizes were sizable for the price point.  Overall, so glad we stopped here for a late lunch on Fremont!

cpmxMhmf77ZSN7kBPKEMuw.text: After initially being told that there was a 2 hour wait for a table on a Friday night, I was a bit peeved- heck, I was pissed! Especially since they apparently don't take reservations on weekends. But my friends were running late, so I decided to go ahead and put my name on the list. After I checked in on Yelp, viola, suddenly a table became available! Hmm, funny how that worked!   Once we got the table, though, things were pretty smooth sailing. Our waiter, Rico, was very patient and sweet with our big group without being overbearing.  The food was... okay. At least my meal was. I ordered the Baja shrimp burrito, and it was FULL of onion and cilantro- too much so. The shrimp itself, though, was very good, big and flavorful. The prices were reasonable as well, my burrito was $14.95. My margarita was a little on the sweet side and not much alcohol, but it was free with my Yelp check in, so I can't complain too much.   I don't know that Nacho Daddy would be my first choice Downtown, but I wasn't upset about the experience.

vukRMzNxHPqaLe4XJiEl8w.text: Came for late dinner on a Friday night. We were told by the sassy hostess that there'd be a 30 minute wait. When we asked if we could have a seat at the bar she abruptly ran inside to the bar as if it was not first come first serve. If this is the case, that would be super weird. We opted to wait. Seems like the sassy short little hostess sensed our frustration; one minute into the wait she ran over to me and stated she had a table and could now seat us.  The service was good and so was the food. We ordered filet mignon nachos and chicken enchiladas with green sauce to share. The star of the show to me with the fillet mignon nachos.   This is a good place to grab a bite if you're in downtown Las Vegas. Just be willing to look past any unnecessary attitude from the hostess.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Enchiladas with Green Sauce
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon Nachos
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon Nachos

BO2ghpw_134nOGBx5aOEZw.text: Nacho Daddy Downtown has officially taking the #1 spot in my most favorite locations! I have now dined at all of the ones around town but this one by far takes the cake. My family was visiting from out of town and I decided to book a reservation online since it was the weekend and with this location being downtown I anticipated it to be packed. Boy was I right! It pays to be proactive in these kind of situations...  When we arrived our party of 6 was greeted by the friendly hostess outside and from there, seated right away! Shortly after are awesome server came over I believe his name was Erick but he spelled it with an A.. like Aerick or something? Anyways he was really pleasant to have on this dining experience. Super attentive, funny and just all around the perfect server.   For drinks we started off with a few margaritas and I used the Yelp check in margarita option with an upgraded tequila.. second round with with a top shelf Cadillac margarita and it was the bomb! Made Just how I like it!   Food was delicious we ordered:  Chicken Enchiladas- Tender chicken wrapped up in two thick corn tortillas, smothered in red or green enchilada sauce, Monterey jack cheddar cheese & sour cream.  Smothered Burrito- Flour tortilla stuffed with your favorite protein, refried beans, Mexican rice, Monterrey jack & cheddar cheese smothered in your choice of red or green enchilada sauce. Served with sour cream, guacamole, salsa, pico de gallo & house-made Chips.   Mix & Match (Any 2) Fajitas - Filet Mignon & Grilled Shrimp. Served with fajita peppers & onions, cherry tomato pico de gallo, sour cream & guacamole with a side of Mexican rice & refried beans, flamed tableside. Choice of flour or corn tortillas & Daddy's salsa.  Nacho Daddy For The Win!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6veY2eOSkxlh_5e57Cy5nA.text: Have been to the location on the strip. Decided to try the downtown location. Friendly atmosphere. Great Queso. Also had a pineapple mint margarita Amazing! Great server Rico was the best.Chris kept our water filled. Nice to dine at a place with good customer service

qcIuLvoftALdQFsJ3uPvvw.text: Great service ! Big huge nachos ! Every single bit of the nachos had something on the chip! Really good margaritas. This was our first visit to this location.. smaller with not much seating we had a table of six and was seated in about 20 minutes .. worth the wait... we did have some older people in our party that had to use a flashlight to read the menu because it was very dark in there ... they do serve breakfast as well ... I am for sure coming back to try that

NEfOYn45epwiWL2DKfqpsA.text: If you like nachos, definitely come here. It's a bit of a messy experience. Service was great and the nachos were good. I got the buffalo hot nachos and there was a bit too much buffalo sauce on it for me to eat all of it, not to mention the huge portion. Others in my group liked theirs too.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jeWgtm4X5pOqoETw-Ox0Xg.text: We thought we were getting in from the rain to have a snack and were not prepared for the amazing Thai Nachos and Supreme Tostada Nachos that Rico brought to our bistro table; the BEST explotion-of-flavor nachos I've ever had. Service was helpful snd the food came out fast...

d-kMPoYmyQm-JxbHfZUTVw.text: HUGE portions, and delicious margaritas, try the cucumber jalapeno! My husband had the fajitas and was very pleased with how much meat there was, and I had the baja burrito that I'm sure I'll have dreams about now. Super great place if you're hungry or like leftovers. Service was good and food came out fairly quick.

0uSa-UQUNK6NKd0ax9Az3Q.text: Dinner was awesome!   We had the Golden Knights Nachos and the Thai Chicken bowl.  Drinks were yummy!  I would give 5 stars but we were there early (3pm) and our waiter was stretched way too thin.  Not his fault and we tipped well but he was covering several tables inside AND outside.  They just needed more coverage but other than that it was great.  Would definitely go again

GdmwRmccy4hMdjWMdMMipg.text: Another great experience at Nacho Daddy downtown! This location is always busy, yet the service is still fast and friendly. You must try the White queso with spicy beef dip. The white queso  is to die for! The tortilla chips are perfect, prepared nice and thin. Also the margaritas are great. The white peach is my favorite. Try it on the rocks instead of frozen though,  just a suggestion ;)

SxoKbhPRNOKAhySW34hbLw.text: This place is awesome. Kayla is the best no down. No question wassup come here ask for Kayla and you're set. Super sweet girl food is dope af better not miss it if your in town.

1J-72oDF0e0stqSWS4DMKw.text: We went here on a Friday night in late January. What a wonderful highlight to our Vegas weekend.  We were there for Happy Hour......great service, amazing food and perfect cheap prices!  The waitress even let us preordered our next drinks before Happy Hour expired...and delivered when we were ready for another.

a9atRWd__-QBbRIkpXlr2w.text: Me and the kiddos wanted some legit nachos and I found this spot on Yelp. Parking was ok, had to go in the structure across the street so it wasn't that bad. Due to the dark tent, we stood there unsure if they were open or not. My daughter figured it out that they were. We ordered the chicken nachos and they were supposed to have jalapenos but they were MIA. We got them on the side few minutes later. Overall great experience, nice vibe and definitely want to try other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. She asked where&#39;s da Jalapeños

pP8zQfSRu9jXMe1A2L9G9Q.text: WHAT?! What is this magical place? Why has no one told me sooner? This world where everyone's favorite food group (that's right, FOOD GROUP) is not only featured, but the focus of their menu. How awesome is that? Could it get more awesome? Yes it could (if they put one in San Diego) being in Vegas is pretty amazing!   Located in Downtown Fremont, it is pretty convenient, especially if you're in the Nacho mood. Patio seating with an aircraft hangar style door, also a great centrally located industrial concrete bar, and warm sunlight.   Because we seemingly don't know how to settle for a stock off the menu selection we went with the Supreme Tostada Nacho, but asked for the pico on the side and also a side of the enchilada sauce, but without the lettuce (cause that did seem weird, right?). First, how awesome was the bartender? They brought out our order and he immediately noticed the presence of lettuce and threw up the stop sign. All apologies, it was returned to the kitchen and a fresh prepped replacement was brought shortly thereafter. Second, these were the best nachos ever!!!! Ermergosh! Such a great blend of flavors and I was halfway through the order, before I remembered we had the sides. Unfortunately, I had waited so long that the enchilada sauce had cooled before I got to it, because I'm sure warmer would have been better (still pretty good).   I digress, let me finish this thing. Aside from amazing nachos, the bar hosts plenty of tequila (as they should), some decent beer (some local), and a friendly, smiling, engaging, conversational, smart, fun staff. Who wouldn't want to be here, eat here, roll around in a pool of nachos here?

AvNbCLVBvMZGl4MrxN1QQg.text: First off when you walk in... definitely not what I expected! Super nice, staff was great! Only negative comment? Too small. The food was to say the least perfect! I asked the bartender what she would recommend and so I got the chimichanga. I was not disappointed. This thing was massive! (Insert wildly inappropriate joke) crispy, delicious, and flavorful. The margaritas were ok. A little too salty but still good. This was our first time to Vegas and the first place we ate. We will be making it a tradition to go back to nacho daddy whenever we are in town. Yuuuuuuum!

QbwnXy1UqW0HXUcFHB9MeQ.text: Rico is the man. Took care of us while we waited with pitcher service outside and was an amazing server inside with all our meals in an 11 person group. Solid dude and solid food, with plenty of options for everyone. This place is awesome.

971hONHpsP9LYNNgp5E2Wg.text: If I had to choose a sit-down restaurant for Mexican food and I was the one paying the bill, I'd choose Nacho Daddy.  Otherwise, I'd choose another, more expensive restaurant with a view of the entire valley and is clear across town from this one (and shall remain nameless for this review :).   As far as atmosphere goes, Nacho Daddy knows how to have a party, whether for fun, a sports event on television, or a date  - ehh, not so much for a date.  But definitely fun with a bunch of friends and family.

ovthIOaEgSQg1SGShExmKg.text: First visit the food was worth 4 stars but service was lacking. Took forever for drinks and to finally give food order. Never checked on again after food was served and then check was incorrect. Tried again this trip. Asked to sit outside, and she said ok rolled her eyes and said she will see if she can find someone to serve us. Sat for 20 minutes servers went out to tables on either side of us and would say hi in passing but never asked about drinks or anything. So we just left.

KL7vwYt94rmFFQ0gcC0WaQ.text: My 10 year old daughter and I were looking for a late lunch / mid-day snack downtown. We decided to check out this place. It took a minute to get seated (that is a good sign when a place is busy), but we were greeted almost right away by Palynn (under pressure with a long line she was great!) and seated as soon as possible. We ordered the ahi nachos. AMAZING!!!!  All of the food is fresh and quality ingredients. Not cheap cuttin corners food. Really good food. And our server Casey was fantastic. The place was packed. She was super busy, but checked in with us frequently and made sure we were happy. My daughter said this place is on her list now of places we need to come back to!  And she's a tougher critic than I am!  Definitely check this place out and wait in line if there is one because it's worth the wait.

kyxg7rwnCvE8mO42t-pI6g.text: My recommendation to this Place: double ur size. Hire some people who want to work for you.

hDf9DAnXCFBX3yuCvADwRQ.text: This place is excellent, first time here.  Rico is superb and he provided the best customer service that I've experienced in awhile.  When I go somewhere to eat with a significant other I expect great service and Rico definitely provided.  He definitely came thru makes Nacho Daddy what it should be; like any business, customer service comes first and Rico knows that.  Thanks Rico and Joseph :) we'll be back :D

bkmEFbc4JDyJ0WtAe6_N9A.text: As far as late night bites after drinking your way through Fremont st goes,  Nacho Daddy is killer.  The portions are huge,  the menu is simple to understand,  and the atmosphere is welcoming.    With a location a few steps away from the Downtown Grand,  you can stumble your way here with ease,  and then catch your Uber home.    They have a lot of non - traditional Nacho options,  a little something for everyone.  My friends and i tried:  Golden knight Nachos- more of a traditional loaded nacho  Buffalo chicken nacho - fun and novelty kind of nacho  Pulled pork bbq nacho - interesting but delicious flavor combo.    I would definitely be back when my cravings get out of control

Keep in mind i have been to nacho Daddy many times for Monday margaritas with some of my customers and coworkers so i was confused on what was going on. WlnP0pjUnEairWnh_4YmGw.text: The food here is delicious! Lots of options, too (my vegan sister was really excited by their full page of vegan options!) It only cost like $9 to begin with! Come on! xDzMOSC-UJhuqx-bR4ZWkg.text: I had breakfast here this morning and I didn't want to have a large breakfast.  I ordered the Anaheim taco which consists of Anaheim chilies, sour cream, sauteed onions, a blend of three cheeses, a slice of avocado all placed on a taco with scrambled egg.  The taco was not a flour one.  It was more like a pastry crust rather than a flour tortilla, but it was very good.  The menu says that all breakfast tacos are served with potatoes or refried beans and rice.  I was offered neither.  I did have a choice of mild, medium, or hot for the salsa and I chose hot.  It's mildly hot if that's not an oxymoron. Breakfast was good and the server refilled my coffee when he saw I was getting low.  This place just opened a month ago and they're still doing work on it.  This morning, they were installing a garage door in the bar area that can be raised in good weather and serve from a counter on which the door rested today.  Part of the fun of eating here today was watching my server change the Coke cartridges.  The syrup now comes in super concentrated containers that look like copy machine cartridges and it was interesting watching him switch out two of the cartridges. The change in technology was interesting.  I parked underground in the Neonopolis garage and there was no charge.  I don't know if it's because of the time of day or that I was there less than an hour, but this is the second time that the cashier at the pay station just wished me a good day and opened the gate.  Nacho Daddy is worth a return visit when they get the kinks worked out. And gentlemen, aim for a field goal!

R5Bq_n-Gy-HnmSX8vST9Xw.text: So we decided to try this place based on the Stars & pictures posted. But I have to say I was a little disappointed. I ordered a michelada based on the pic in the menu, what I got was a beer with Tabasco & lime in a cup used for water. The rim had an enormous amount of margarita salt. And I have no idea what kind of beer was used since the waitress didn't ask me. The filet minon nachos were ok. Nuthin to write home about. The meat was not as tender as I had hoped. Crab & lobster street tacos were ok, they stuff more corn in it than the crab/lobster. But they were tasty.  This place was just 'OK'  I think the pics are amazing but unfortunately the taste isn't.

S0PdLYVaitMftzbii3xEVw.text: We've gone here several times for lunch and have ordered takeout as well. (We went to the original location in Henderson many times before this one, though; so imagine my excitement when there was one closer to home!) I must've forgotten to do a review on this place. This is one of my favorite places to get nachos, my favorite pig-out food. (I have a restricted diet monday through friday.)   My favorite place to get nachos used to be Mickie Finnz but honestly, there is no other place to get nachos anymore. Out of the fifteen nacho types, we've tried about eight of them! Our favorite is "Nacho Average Burger Nacho."  Doesn't look very big from the outside, but when you get inside, the bar is on the left side (probably bigger than the dining area), and the sit-down dining area is on the right side. The bathrooms are at the very back, right side. The counter (where to go for your takeout order) is to the right, front side, of the restaurant. Every server we've had has been very nice.   Not much parking, but a couple spaces in front, if you're lucky, for the takeout order.

oVOANexo68FhrCFu9bqbOw.text: It was good but not worth the price.  The chips they say are house made are very weak.  The chips were completely soggy after about 20 minutes of being under the other ingredients.

c_D2eWP_AIBvV49A7LancQ.text: Solid place with plenty of vegetarian options. They make their own chips and salsa. Margaritas were huge and very nice. I had an awesome plate of vegan nachos which were fresh and plentiful. I also enjoyed the guacamole with my chops and it was tremendously magnificent. Our dishes were wonderful and we plan on revisiting. It's reasonably priced in an ideal location and recommend it.

XHJCXw7wh7wKg37ggV__VA.text: Amazing place for a late night snack. My wife and I shared the burger nachos and received a complimentary margarita with checking into yelp. Very affordable and very good! Definitely recommend!

RUYaOIlKsQFX9Mc3rENF7A.text: It's a bit on the pricy side but it's definitely good. I appreciate that there's a decent selection for vegetarians too. I had the Thai Chicken bowl and I definitely recommend it. It's labeled as "Spicy Hot" but the label is probably meant as a warning for those who don't eat spicy at all. The spiciness came from some jalapenos so it wasn't actually hot at all.

ULAdOwBSAP_46GlafQ5Edg.text: Amazing food ,great prices , comfortable atmosphere . Front of the house team very professional and friendly , we'll definitely return due to first time experience .

bTMUr2tJV-9zG0dnaih8Nw.text: Everything we had was good, even the guacamole, which is rare for even authentic Mexican restaurants. I got the tostada nachos with no meat and they were delicious. If you're vegan, they have a whole page of delicious options so definitely give it a try. My bf got the smothered burrito with filet mignon and green enchilada sauce and he said it was also very good. By far my FAVORITE thing we had was the queso! I scraped the bowl just to get one more chip full out of it. Best queso I have ever had. We will be back!

-sJWnZIqUsiHEVOLAFz1yw.text: Bomb diggity nachos.  Yes, 20 bucks for filet nachos is pricey, but damn they were good; best nacho meat I have had.  Suggest you order the ranchero sauce on the side to keep the chips nice and crispy.  The start can be a little rocky cause it is wait to be seated, the standing area in front is very small, and it can take a while to get acknowledged, but once seated the waitress Nancy was friendly and attentive.  Didn't drink, but good draft selection.  Reccomended.

lHXuzqhiLaQ4ARvE9VaFIw.text: Went there this evening, 3/2, and it was over priced and under valued.  If you want crappy Mexican food that you could do better at home, this is the place.   And the margaritas, what a joke, a $40 pitcher of sweet and sour mix is all this was.   Four people at the table and no one could taste or feel any tequila at all.  What a crappy bar tender.     But at the end of the day, I am sure that the owners and managers don't really care because in this city you get a new batch of tourists, and their money, every week.

4tA2hV6aDSV1TZmpoQfz2g.text: Great vegan and veggie choices. Been here many times. The our last view was a real treat! I had been craving a chimi for years and the sweet server said he would go back and ask if they could do a vegan one....of course they could! I ordered a bean and cheeze and avocado chimi :D I wish I took a pic of it it was soooo yummy and gooey and ridiculous :D I asked for black beans with mango salsa on top as my side.   Anyway, this place will make you just about anything you want. I even requested the kale salad be put into a wrap before and yep they did it.  Service is slow sometimes but always pleasant. The owner is a sweetheart, glad he left what he was doing to open his Nacho Daddy's ;)   We had a Yelp event at the one at Henderson and after that we tried Hendo location again after that....ummmm we are not a fan.   We have had some yummy veggie fajitas here also (don't know if they are a menu item). You can't beat their nachos. I wish they had a cauliflower buffalo vegan nacho like I have made at home then I would truly be in heaven. My fav item is still the kale salad. It's that dressing, that grilled corn, delicious.   That spicy tofu burrito is out of this world but wow it's freaking spicy I don't know how my bro in law nor my hubby eats that. They always inhale theirs.  I'm not a fan of adult drinks and hubby is allergic to tequila (in an oopma loompa turning orange type of way) so not really sure about their margs etc but my friend said her special tooty fruity marg was super yum and super strong.   Nacho Daddy IS the Nacho Daddy.

fs5Bv027GbKe82LjxQbjDg.text: I was a little afraid that this place was going to be a tourist trap with mediocre food, given it's location.  It was of course a tourist trap but it was also super super tasty.  I had the huevos rancheros (breakfast all day!!) it was so good I ate way beyond full.  They serve it with gauc and salsa, both were great, but totally unnecessary-the huevos were perfect as is. Oh, Oh, Oh! They made my eggs perfectly over medium.  I don't know if you've ever ordered over medium eggs before but it's quite the gamble.  Kudos to the cooks! My partner in crime ordered the Nachos and walked out with a food baby as well.  He had some super tasty raspberry margarita which totally trumped my guava daiquiri.    On a side note: Our server was pretty much MIA during the meal but this was obviously due to the fact that she was in the weeds.  I think she may have been the only one on.  The food would definitely bring me back but not having anyone check on us until we were almost done eating would keep me away.  Hopefully it was a fluke and not standard practice!

_MAKnPTjgQReUYqiVOgmsw.text: Food - Just okay. Bland.   Drinks - We ordered 2 margaritas, both were terrible! They tasted like we were drinking sugary syrup.   Price - Overpriced for what you get.  Overall - Disappointed.

rTHhWaRCdgGXjr_qBACu1A.text: Damn I came in last last min and they let me come in and take the Famous Scorpion Shot...BIG BIG props to the GM Chris...P.S Ariel is a dope bartender, personality is everything, and she most definitely got the juice haha...

WHBrKAMd0u_0uBAfgE-f7A.text: Do the scorpion shot it's amazing and thanks z for the service very friendly. Just down the road from freemont.

_5K2izkwqwPHHQ1gCoANTQ.text: Everybody just calm down. Chips with processed cheese and grilled onions and peppers does not make a 5 star joint. They got our simple order wrong (not busy whatsoever) and the strawberry margarita was so syrupy sweet we just couldn't drink more than a couple sips.  When we asked about making a new one or returning it they just flippantly said that's the way they make them, $10 down the drain.  I know it's hard to find good help but the server just had no clue about customer service, pick up the straw paper, take our dirty dishes that have been sitting here for half an hour while we're waiting for our check (again, not busy at all) bring us napkins and silverware. You don't think it's odd when you bring us a plate of food and there's nothing on the table?  They slung our plates on the table and ran forcing us to yell at them to ask for napkins and silverware. Of course that wasn't his job, so he said he would get our server to help us with our problem.

I was contented. I would like to explore the menu more.   Whilst in Vegas, hop over to Nacho Daddy. You'll be glad you did.

4JkXEuMBeI4FY3jQ9GJdbA.text: Okay yum.  The assortment of nachos is unbelievable.  I chose the Thai chicken nachos.  They were so good.  My friends ordered the enchilada nachos and elote.  The elote was a little sweet for my taste.  I felt like it needed some hot sauce.  My friend who ordered it however, was in love.  She said it's better than the elote she makes herself.  We checked in for 2 house margaritas which were pretty good.  The only reason I took off a star is because when we were sat, we were told someone was going to be our server. Turns out the guy who was supposed to be our server was just chatting with a couple tables directly behind us.  It was kind of weird.  Next time I'll try the other location. ie-VUdnXz_2NtN3N8KUmVA.text: LOVED our visit to Nacho Daddy's. Dean was our  server and even though it was a busy night he was perfectly attentive and friendly. TZ0rOXQIIvPaIrQFU_77Hw.text: This place is banging. Homemade everything. Chips, dips, guacamole, salsa, and this heavenly queso that I basically wanted to drink out of the bowl. Our server was awesome, attentive, made sure our drinks were just as full as our bellies.  I don't think that any of the nacho plates would be bad, they all sounded great. We decided to eat the Supreme tostada nacho's, which was basically a classic with some surprises. The beef is seasoned perfectly, and they serve it with something they call avocado lime salsita, it was perfect.  The day we were there, they didn't have the corn-on-the-cob, it was off the cob, but for real, it was the best tasting Mexican style corn ever. We could eat here every other day, no joke, I can't wait to go back and try the BBQ pulled pork nachos!

jrXgk0YkE0cjVTMaZYNifg.text: We had a great meal for a good price. We got the tostada nacho supreme which was more than enough food for the both of us. Our server, Rico was super helpful and friendly. He made our dinner so much more enjoyable.
