rzOta56hh1lf_yXTHm5RjA.text: The vegan nachos are great and check in margaritas are usually good too. The servers are usually friendly and attentive...but the hostesses...not so much. Ive been here about 5 times this year and every time theyre either unfriendly or absent! Most of the time there is no hostess there and we have waited up to 10 mins to find the hostess just to ask for a table...its crazy because the other 2 locations are on top of it! The wait for a table can be long at this location compared to the others. Hopefully they step it up because their food is good and reasonable for the portion size.

xhXJfqJpdVatm2DED_fUlg.text: Came in for a nacho but decided to get the Buffalo Hot Wings and that decision was great most of all was was the free margarita

NJBODV13Atw8XmQfdy3Lfw.text: We had seen the giant sign outside many times and I finally talked my wife into letting me try this place.  It's bigger and nicer inside than I expected it to be.  I asked the server what the specialty was and she said the burger nacho so that is what I ordered.  The portion was very large and the chips were great and the cheese sauce was pretty good too.  The burger part was a chilly type sauce that you would find on hot dogs.  It wasn't bad but could have used a lot more flavor and some spice.  To kick it up I had to use a lot of hot sauce.  There were also no jalapeno peppers.   My wife had the vegan tofu nachos and loved them but this is my review on what I had.  The bottom line for me is if you are a nacho place and some gets your signature dish it should be oh wow.  What I had was ok not oh wow.  Average ok place.

v9eSTp1BtHeL-l1yZQM8Nw.text: absolutely awsome... kimmie and the team was perfect... the food was the best in town....very friendly atmosphere and playing football was very cool... they also have breakfast all day which my wife got the chillaquilles and i got the nachos supreme.... one of the best foods ive ate on my trip here... thank you kimmie

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chillaquilles with scrambled eggs

kV4oUS21xTSrlRe-sD4QRQ.text: Went there for the queso dip and a margarita.  Both were amazing! Will definitely go back when I am in Vegas!

qVvJ8WdcMYihVw0nvLgCQw.text: Nacho Daddy delivered on all fronts. The margaritas were strong and tasty (although the original lime margarita was a tad too sweet), the street tacos were great, and the fiesta nachos did not disappoint. Our waiter Marc was by the far the best part of our experience at Nacho Daddy. He was friendly, prompt, and extremely helpful with recommending popular menu items. If you're in Fremont and looking for a casual bite to eat I definitely recommend Nacho Daddy. The prices are fare, the portions are large, and the service is excellent.

eHaq5ODz0RBGTfGnoBng0A.text: The carnitas was not very flavorful and undercooked. Probably pressure cooked and not enough spices rather than slow cooked the traditional way. The burrito they charge extra for guacamole and sour cream. The guacamole was inside the burrito which is a mistake. There was no sour cream. No salsa on the side at all. Could use improvement.  Plus: nice friendly staff and good beers. That's the only reason for 3 stars.

AesBBmtL4K-BWlgnVS9k7g.text: Have been to the bar for drinks. Never the best service but ok cocktails. Decided to try food because of good reviews. Ordered queso dip and Mexican lasagna to go. Nothing was wrong with the order but did not love the food at all. Queso was like a white processed cheese with not a lot of flavor & I took 1 bite of the lasagna and hated it. My husband ate it said it wasn't the best.. So many better options out there to choose from. Won't be back

zlD6sDACRqfuU5rZvwsZIw.text: Great place. Nice chill atmosphere and the service was great! Food was wonderful with fresh bottomless chips and salsa for just 2.95.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage &amp; Egg sliders only $4 each  during happy hour!

bG24ieKtzdD4U2IN00EvCA.text: Out of all the eateries to go to Downtown -- I would not suggest this one.  My friend and I met up here after work for a bite to eat. The place is small and cramped, and I think they could have alleviated that problem by making the bar just a bit smaller and instituting some smaller bar seats, as the seats take up to much room in the walk-ways.   Happy hour consists of $5 margaritas and $4.50 Mexican beers they have on draft. Not the largest selection for a HH, but not bad. There is food on the HH menu as well. I ordered the shrimp tacos and out they came as fried shrimp tacos, which I would have liked to have known and wish the menu would have pointed that out.  My friend and I also shared a nacho platter, ahem, since we were at a place called NACHO Daddy I had great expectations. They arrived in no time and were placed on our table. As I looked at this platter of nachos I questioned many things in life, "When a tree falls in the woods and no one is around, does it make a sound?"... "When I am at a place that specifically has Nachos in its' name and I am unimpressed with the nachos... are they really nachos at all?"  We got the Filet Mignon Carne Asada Nachos. I have reservations on whether or not the meat was actually filet mignon. I also have reservations now on ever ordering a $16.95 priced plate of nachos, which I expected to be bigger, and better.  Next time I want nachos I will go to Roberto's and ask for Carne Asada Nachos and I'll eat the &*&! out of those things and be happy I didn't pay $17 for them.

gMnrkm2JFEyUVdVIMULKUA.text: Lauren is a fantastic server and gave us excellent service the first time I dined here. We did not have to ask for what we wanted, she knew or she asked us. Love it!  However, the second time I came was not so fantastic. Miss pouty face server told us 3 times in a 20 minute period that they were "still brewing coffee". It takes 5 not 20. We were not checked up on until Lauren took over our table 50 minutes into our experience and we JUST got a second cup of coffee. Thank you Lauren for making it happen.  I don't attribute a negative Yelp review to one servers poor customer service though. The food is delicious, the environment is great, 70 different types of tequila is rad, and the owner was kind. I love the restaurant concept.

SW6OhdigkA0bVSI13RC_eA.text: We've been sitting down for 20 minutes at the bar and we can't even order our drinks and it's not even crowded. Our bartender is Christina and she took our drink order with an attitude after we waited for so long. Never coming back!

3GfJssI5BXaehr-eO_V7UQ.text: This place is delicious and our bartender (Griffin, I believe) was great. Chill but on point with service. We were staying at the Golden Nugget and visited this place 3 times in a 24 hour period. Had 2 different kinds of nachos, breakfast taco, huevos rancheros and lots of beer! Definitely our go to place from now on!

_M5JBtsEm8hPPKkXF8wnFA.text: Excellent service from Mikey. We had the spicy shrimp nachos and the filet carne nachos. Both where so of the best we ever had. Split 2 orders between 4 of us. Mikey real made dinner an enjoyable experience . Vibe is cool. Lots of draft beer choices . You can't go wrong here for a quick cheap bite.

EC--PU3ER2VO4v8CiV9Q3A.text: It was my first time here with my friends great spot to have a late dinner nachos were good and the service was great very friendly staff and clean place will be coming back thanks Mark for your great service!!!

CBUN39vwpjvUj4G7hxCrKA.text: The fiesta nachos were sooooooooo delicious. I enjoyed my brunch there. The mango margarita and house margaritas are also good. We got the pitcher for both. The service is also good!!!!

4g3D8knaT7njDQ1wVlJZxQ.text: I've been meaning to come in here ever since I heard there's a vegan menu and my only regret is that I didn't come sooner. Food is Amazing! Vegan chick'n fajita bowl and loaded nachos for the win. Our server, Luis, was awesome too, super nice and crazy fast. Definitely come in!

L9PC1IsgR9xQPitYzTACbw.text: Be aware, there is no longer happy hour on Saturdays!!! We used to go there all the time (we live nearby) but likely will not be back. The service is always slow because Nacho Daddy always seems understaffed. Our waiter complained to us one time that he was the only one responsible for the dining area! The food is ok, the margaritas by the glass are good (quality for pitcher margaritas strangely varies), but the service was really only worth it for happy hour. Most disappointing is that the website still advertises happy hour while they don't honor it! We'll go somewhere else.

yg0fT0-k-D6NcMCCjSBSUA.text: Buffalo nachos and the tacos were amazing!  Also our server was attentive and friendly.

xhCy2HIzuB1QAPT9spX22g.text: My husband and I don't get downtown very often, but when we do we always make sure to stop in and see our favorite red headed spit fire, Courtney! She is the best. Always so happy, upbeat, oh and she makes a wicked margarita! Next time you are downtown be sure to stop in and see her, you won't be disappointed!

PWLY9c2FGROwkR15K98GLQ.text: i've been on maury, ricky lake, etc. i still don't know who my daddy is. but the bartender had answers for me. she told me the caddy marg was the way to go. she also led me to the spicy skrimp nachos. her guidance has resolved my father issues. i feel ready to move on. you should come here. if you have any doubts, questions, or concerns please don't call me. if you must, dial 1-800-666-OKAY. best of luck, ya shmuck.

B0hlrV4_RNRLicztPTB7lw.text: My wife and I have been here twice and each time the food was very good.  The atmosphere fun and staff engaging.  It is a nice break from the tourist rat race.  We will return every time we are in Vegas.

UlCa5p3C9lyhMIyJYvnSSQ.text: Great street tacos! Have yet to be disappointed!  Service is good and have always been treated well! Celebrated a coworkers last day at the office with one of those shots with a scorpion! My really likes the Churro Sunday!

yU1YfIRyMLFJyTkELZqbFw.text: First time stopping by here, good chill environment perfect place for a sit down, drinks food and away from all the craziness from downtown for a bit. Our server Kayla was nice and provided excellent service! Would definitely recommend this place to anybody and everybody! Definitely coming back, thank you! ;)

97vV1orUOI1mgrdrJj-XRw.text: Great food, good service, and a scorpion shot to boot!   Food was really great here and the service was really good too.   The scorpion shot was more to say you did it than anything else. All it is, is a shot of your choice with a dead scorpion in it.   Yes you can eat the scorpion, or you can take it home. I ate mine, my wife coughed hers up, so she took hers home :p

3AMio3sjoqmiqQP7y5QPbw.text: Ordered the 3 tacos, and did not like them they were very dry and didn't have the best taste (we went with the chicken tacos) also tried their enchilada nachis and those were good!

7RJHbMa7rRr_pQM84V4qvQ.text: Nachso good service Angie.  Last night we returned to see if our service would be better than my previous trip as outlined below. We brought a friend from BC for some food and drinks. Upon arrival there was a table on the patio with customers so we chose the opposite side after waiting a short time my wife went in and asked the Bartender if we could get service. Answer was yes. 23 minutes passed , no service so she went inside ordered 2 shots of Julio 42 and a Reposado.  Finally a server with Bunny ears came out and took our food order. Really piss poor service.  I get it.  Downtown deals with tourists equals crappy service.  Hopefully your new store in Summerlin will care about and cater to locals.  Will give it one last try.  Thx Earle We stopped in to check ND's out.  Heard about Nachos from watching it on the TV show Mystery Diners. Also a big sign out front advertising $5 tacos and $6 Titos  We sat at the Bar and had a great time talking with him. The day we dined was National Taco Day as well as Vodka Day. Go figure. Tacos and Vodka.  With that said.  Nachos had $6 Titos cocktails. So we had street tacos and Titos  Later that evening we decided to return with a friend for a cocktail. We ordered 3 Titos and service was really slow "different bartender"  took forever to pay.  Got the bill and the bartender charged us $9 a drink instead of the posted $6 price. After some discussion they finally adjusted the bill. Then sent a guy out front to take down the posted special sign.  Not sure if or when we will return

_oqDqjukaIYJZ-wormth1w.text: This is a very welcome, un-Vegasy place to get a quick, relatively cheap tasty meal and drinks! I love nachos and think nacho-focused restaurants should really start taking off, especially if they have a play-on-words name because I also love that. So many kinds of nachos but my husband wanted to stay away from anything too spicy so we hot the Nacho Average Burger nachos and they were great! The meat was well seasoned, the queso was good, and then of course there was also bacon. I got the spicy blood orange margarita and it was just too spicy for me, I was dying, but I couldn't stop drinking it, because it was delicious! My husband's house margarita was also excellent.

GQjGT5dcC7AJT5kZ3qD60g.text: I absolutely love this place. Their unique ingredients in the different nacho dishes are tasty but my favorite here are the burritos

6tTy4UtRqXh83yi33dt8gg.text: Absolutely loved the vegan nachos and the vegan street tacos! Also had a decent selection of draft beers. I will be back a lot. Atmosphere was okay but the bartender was really nice and let us sample new beers before we settled on one.

VE-LXL0FRukLIzZshvlkCQ.text: We came here for my husband 30th birthday and was very please with everything. He took a scorpion shot which was an awesome experience. The food and drinks were good, me and my mother in law had the street tacos, my husband had the famous nachos which were delicious. I wish there was more lighting and not such a long wait until a waiter comes to take your order. We did have a problem with our waiter swiping our card with the chip and causing it to be deactivated. But, other than that we enjoyed ourselves for our first time to Vegas.

RBNP6V5OBXMk3w5Vb4FKgg.text: It is pretty good.  I think the nachos selection is great.  I didn't try any drinks really but they did look tasty.

3k1Ieze4xP3VYEy6lYCcFg.text: Soooooo, my girlfriend is vegan so I in turn eat a fair amount of vegan food. I typically am not impressed by vegan cheese but oh buddy let me tell you about Nacho Daddy. The quesadilla and the nachos were fantastic and the cheese seemed like the real deal. Amazing. I also ordered the avocado tacos, which is one of my favorite vegan dishes. These tacos did not disappoint. Delicious. Highly recommend this place. Enjoy!

YS1Za0HNdQxFI06kVqMIkw.text: Superb service by Dean!  Very attentive, friendly and helpful. Go here at Downtown Vegas!

KI-1AlyCrXfgunwZ9WT_Wg.text: Rico and Bryson were amazing! Good food & good drinks, can't ask for anything better. Thanks for making our night amazing!

4rNXSdrm4YhTscg6ssMB2A.text: The Lobster and Crab Nachos are over the top. Enough to feed two Americans or an entire European village. Margaritas have the perfect amount of alcohol.

937TW064b8YQlt44YqeaMA.text: After getting in a car next door I came over here to sit on the patio and enjoy my stick and a good margarita I ordered some very tasty flavored spicy buffalo wings with blue cheese and celery quite tasty I enjoy the Ambiance watch the game and had a great time and more importantly quick-service and was left alone

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r4jid4B-CjzhGzyrnNuCuw.text: A clutch place for the gluten free crowd, their menu is loaded with clearly marked gluten free choices.  With specialties of nachos and margaritas, you really can't go wrong stopping in for a lunch and beverage while visiting Fremont Street.  Their menu contains several other options including breakfast.  If I'm going to stop at a restaurant labeled Nacho Daddy, it's a certainty there are going to be some nachos in transit through my digestive system.  I stopped in once myself and another time with my wife, giving me ample opportunities to sample their nachos.  The filet mignon nachos are fantastic, and I highly recommend having them.  Their four cheese and "cheeseburger" nachos are also amazing.  Keep in mind that their servings are large, so one order might be adequate - depending on your appetite.  Their margaritas are a great combination with their food and can be purchased as a single drink or in a pitcher.  When I visited, there was a free classic margarita with the purchase of an entree for checking in on Yelp!, so have your app handy.  The service was good during my visits, especially from Allie who was very sensitive about the food allergies that my wife and I bring to every dining excursion.  If you need something that hits the spot, be sure to stop in at Nacho Daddy. You're guaranteed a full stomach and a great accompanying cocktail.

GC6qrur9y17rLGyNTY3p7g.text: Brittany was great. She was training at the same time and was very professional. Margaritas were tasty and everybody enjoyed, Mango one was a little to sweet. Food was great for everybody, fajita bowl was amazing and tasty, the taco shell was crisp and just yummy. A few mistakes but were fixed instantly, so no issues with that. Drinks and Food were great again so no issues...   Kayla is always amazing great help with choosing food and drinks. Great personality and remembers the customers.   Dean was our server tonight and he was great also. Simple and easy helpful with choosing drinks.

N7ZO4XApq6EDnU7C811Cww.text: We had such a great experience at Nacho Daddy. The atmosphere was incredible and the service was excellent. We were in a big party and we all left happy. Sabrina our server was super friendly and kept checking in on us the whole time. I will recommend to friends and family

tsh7cgwzRJsWUHvgFODroA.text: Food was very good. They offer a variety of dishes, even Vegan. Full bar and some of there draft selection has the restaurant logo or signature brand to it, even an excellent margarita or 10. Lots of Nacho plates to choose from, tacos & Burritos too.Highly recommend if you're in the Downtown area[Fremont].

RVHvgK5_PqHzaoldvdsZSw.text: Went to get food for my lunch break with my coworkers and spent OVER AN HOUR WAITING FOR MY FOOD. When we asked about the wait. The constantly told us it was coming. We ended up leaving having to take some of our food with us because they did not complete our order and we paid for everything. Talked to the manager who I think is Rene and he acted like he didn't even care showed no remorse or professionalism. This is the worse service I have ever gotten and I don't think I will be coming back.

eyBvnxa8FUA49a4p1MyUIw.text: Love this spot! I've been here a few times and everyone I bring loves it too. The vegan nachos are delicious, and the crab and lobster nachos are out of this world. Drinks are superb as well. Will keep coming back to this restaurant every time I come to Vegas!

0eXY7q8TtT0_enzmnd4oBw.text: Waited 45 minutes for nachos and water. No thank you. We politely left after that time and had a great dinner at White Castle, next door. Nacho Daddy was not even busy nor checked on us after arriving. What a disappointment for us local folks. Will not recommend,  nor come again.

VdLyTi_lODnkFNbEgCFiuQ.text: My second time there and it's still fantastic. I had the buffalo chicken nachos and they were pretty good. I was craving something spicy and it hit the spot. Service was great.

AMqA6qDpnagKlw16zop0Bg.text: I'm definitely no stranger to this place and I'm always pleased when I come here.   If you're looking for a place to get your nachos fixings, this is it. You might be intimidated by their options and combos, but don't worry, because anything you pick is going to hit the spot  I would definitely recommend the Golden Knights Nachos, and they're big enough to share! If you want something lighter, I'd recommend the fajitas for something filling and delicious. I always get a cold beer to compliment the savory flavor of the nachos, so don't be afraid to splurge! If you check in here on Yelp, you can get a free margarita with an entree!!  Anyone who is walking the downtown area should come and check this place out, you won't regret it, and you won't forget it  5 / 5 Stars. Never a let down and you always get more than you expected every time you come.

fWuhmOeaGmENblGUhwItDQ.text: Heard of this place and had been wanting to try it out. Sat at the bar and just our luck we ended up with a really rude server (Taielor). She was really unhelpful and whenever we tried to ask for recommendations/service she seemed upset and had an attitude. This turned us away from trying the food and instead we just paid for our drinks and left. The menu did look good but there was no point in spending our money to get treated so poorly.

o_ks3Hjj-SqdqUWVZMDLFA.text: Awful awfully bad service closed 40 minutes early!!!  I hope they go bankrupt as they deserve!

clNBnCP6qgY46tGTG6OPQw.text: yum love their vegan options! Very friendly servers and great food!

FpwURwZ4HmGn0dLoTEkBFQ.text: The Cycle Pub Crawl took us here as one of the stops but we wish they hadn't. For a chain restaurant, their prices are designed to gouge the nearby tourists. $16 for one Coke and one poorly crafted margarita. This is what you'd expect to pay at a nightclub, but not a crappy chain restaurant. We all ordered drinks upon arriving and a couple of us had to flag down servers for a missing soda and margaritas. We watched the bartender keep dropping his drink recipe notes. The nachos were disgusting. It tasted like stale chips with what looked like dog food on top...I wouldn't feed this to my dog. The servers had no idea who ordered what and settling the bill was a monumental task for them. Make sure you count your change before you leave. A very disappointing experience.  I wouldn't waste my time or money since there are plenty of other better places to go nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scorpion shot

uUc7COZrqJMJPgydPLEqqQ.text: Wow - this restaurant was an incredible find for hungry Vegans. We watched several nacho plates go by and they were huge. I had the Thai chicken plate and our server, Dezi, happily substituted vegan chicken for the meat-eater variety,added back beans, and subtracted the jalapenos.  My goodness - so good.  And the staff is so friendly. We met the manager and the head cook. We really hope this Vegas local restaurant (actually 3 in this area now) will come to Plano/Frisco, and Georgetown/Round Rock areas in Texas. Nothing quite like this gourmet Mexican restaurant with a whole Vegan section in Texas. Try it all you vegans, vegetarians, and meat-eaters.  It's delish.

6AnqDRlRd1n0wXeUHgWyXw.text: Love the food but I'm pissed at the fact the that our bill was 33.29. I put a $20 bill and a credit card down and our server charged the credit card the full amount. The manager noticed our anger when w looked at the bill. She came over to see what was wrong we told her. She handled the situation better than we could ask for by telling us don't worry she'll take care of it but I told her that I put a $20 bill and the credit card in the folder and that she needs to look at the security camera above us because that employee is scamming us and she said he worked for her for 5 years and he would never do that and I insisted that she check the cameras and she refused. WATCH YOURSELVES! The managers could possibly be in on this scam!!!! Always check your bills!!

Aep9nrPDHz32GQXnMNHtsw.text: We had a good bartender but as soon as the woman replaced him the service was terrible. We had high expectations however, it wasn't pleasant or friendly at all. You would think that since tourists venture this place she would have a better attitude to get a better tip. Nope. And as a friend insisted we go back for breakfast the next day it was the same. Do not suggest going here at all unless you're having all day to sit around and not get any help or a bad attitude.

sd-1Exo_Nn_l4XoQX4XfAA.text: Jovanny was awesome from start to finish!! Thank you!! Great atmosphere and the best salsa ever!!

GA7ypiA3lEry4WV3ISx3yA.text: Kimmie the bartender is drop dead gorgeous and knows her shit around a bar. If you want good drinks, come here!

Q_PPPl-MYQAg3jrnAZOUKg.text: Amazing brunch, one of the best coffees I have tried in the US, and awesome staff who would make your experience all the more worthwhile :)'

UGSx8KyvYqRPU1Bw69b0Rg.text: Ordered BBQ nachos at lunch. BBQ sauce way too sweet. onions were not edible, probably a few days old at best.  They were so stale that I couldn't even chew through them.   I get where people would like this place, but I definitely do not see where they could possibly have "Best of Las Vegas" vouching for them unless Las Vegas standards are pretty low.  If you're looking for good food, don't expect anything more in quality than what you would get at TGI Fridays, and I should have known better.   Service was not bad, but not good either. Sitting right below acceptable if I need to be precise.   Vibe is really gringo-y.   Like I said, I could see where people would like this place, but for the first time here my food and service gave me impression that I should not waste my money here again.

fFuMDO6LVY9akZh0W2GZlg.text: great atmosphere along with food and drinks..Anya takes good care of her customers

Rx8JtRLReF2hysB6bcXqaA.text: The only reason they are getting two stars instead of none is their amazing staff. The food was horrific. How in the world do they manage to screw up nachos.... It's in the name!! The enchiladas were atrocious too. I always take my leftovers home because I hate wasting. But this is the very first place I didn't want anything to do with a to go box. None of my friends were impressed either except for the drunk ones.... Which I mean, just plain toast tastes good then. And even that would have tasted fresher than the food we received that was extremely over priced. Never again. Maybe at a different location it will taste different.

EthbaXMwceicMjRDASMQMw.text: We (my niece and I ), found this hole in the wall Jewel the last day we were in Las Vegas. You just would not believe what a great place this is!  The service was outstanding as was the food. Enormous portions, seasoned perfectly and served with plenty of condiments.  We packaged up our leftovers and blessed one of the many homeless folks on Fremont Street.  Don't let your Mexican cravings go unfed. Go to Nacho Daddy's. You won't be disappointed

thPPwcXtZQVVR8tdA6npsw.text: First off very GREAT service from Mark ask for him when you go ! Second very awesome nachos I tried the enchilada nachos with chicken and red sauce it was super delicious ! They have a cool deal also with the purchase of a entree you get a FREE HOUSE MARGARITA  and it wasn't just a whack margarita it was still very strong even though it was free. We stay a The D hotel so if your staying there or golden nugget it very short 5 min walk this place is very good and kid friendly also !

5cRRJb8It05ydpwCjXDncw.text: My husband works nearby (they offer free chips and salsa for "neighbors" btw) and he goes to lunch here a lot. When were in the area around lunch time, he thought this would be the best place to bring our kids. Not all the restaurants downtown are very accommodating to families, so I was worried.  Despite my fears, they were very accommodating. They had high chairs and kids menus out for us in no time at all. They have kid cups which seems minor but I can't tell you how many times down waiter had attempted to hand a big, open top, glass to our toddlers.   The food was amazing, the kids loved  the chicken fingers and BBQ nachos. My husband and I devoured the dip sampler, he has tacos and I had the Mexican burger. It was excellent.  My only complaint is that we had to move the chairs a few times for people to get through because the seating area is small.

r0ZGj9z4dUlQLblmCd682w.text: Jovany is the MAN! Great spot, awesome atmosphere and good food! House margaritas are a staple and must try. Tvs all over the place so nothing is missed. And great walking distance to Fremont

pco79y7EnigNIP8dMnjFZA.text: We were highly disappointed in this establishment, especially after pointing at it all week and thinking that it might be a cool spot to have dinner.  Sigh, more fools us.  We came in on St. Patrick's night and the place was quieter than every other restaurant on the Fremont Street Experience, which should have been our first warning.  We ordered a pitcher of White Peach margaritas and the "average burger" nachos for me, Daddy's Supreme chicken taco for him.  Then we waited patiently, expecting the drinks to come out first.  No such luck - here comes the food.  I look over at my husband's plate and see this really sad-looking taco shell with a bunch of filling in it.  There was more plate than food, and I had a nasty feeling that the rest of the experience wasn't going to be much better than this.  My nachos, at least, had some substance.  But... they were just okay, not great.  The cheese sauce tasted like reheated Cheez Whiz, there was no bacon whatsoever to be found, and the onions were minced so finely that they just disintegrated the moment they touched my tongue.  I was bitterly disappointed.    To make matters worse, the margaritas came when we were nearly done with our food.  Bad, bad timing.  We were pretty much ready to pack up and leave by that point.  Once the drinks came, the experience was slightly better - but, hey, I got drunk.  If it takes getting me drunk to improve things... (and my husband will tell you that he has never seen me tie one on like that, ever)  Final insult:  the bill was 53 dollars, making it the most expensive meal we had in Vegas over the course of a week.  It wasn't close to being worth that.  My husband honestly didn't want to leave a tip at all, but I convinced him otherwise.    It never did get any busier while we were there.  I see why it didn't now.  The only reason why 2 stars - the food was edible and the drinks packed a punch.  But that's it. Servers were polite but in the end did nothing to improve our experience here.  Not recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Average Burger&#34; nachos.  Indeed, they lived up to their name.

r0Mv0AVIDqn25gThwNdTFw.text: We went to Nacho Daddy on one of our Vegas trip, I seriously wanted to give 5 stars since we had a great service and great foods, my wife had their nachos and I had a burrito, the portion is large, we couldn't finish either dish, we also had their house margaritas, pretty good drinks, the only reason why I knock a star out is both of us had really bad heart burn shortly after, in all fairness it could be the margaritas mixed with all of those cheeses and salsas, who knows, I might try them again if I'm staying in downtown.

sFcDBwxheNvbBKJNvxRFkA.text: The good: The selection here for tacos and nachos is pretty great. I loved the bacon wrapped jalapenos with cream cheese. So darn good! Make sure you try the Fireball Scorpion Shots! The service was fine.  The bad: If you wanna pay a lot, come here. Three orders of nachos, 2 cokes and two lunch special tacos plus that wrapped jalapeno equalled $76. Sorry, overpriced for what you get.

jpLVrKiNDSi-T6M935oxOQ.text: With veeeeery few gf vegan options in Las Vegas, I stopped by Nacho Daddies because I saw they at least had a few menu items I could eat. The free yelp check in margarita was a nice thing, and the vegan nachos were average. Not the best dining experience but not the worst.

Z5G54Mn4zWfnJThskF_MYA.text: Literally the BEST Mexican food in town.  Stopped in for happy hour with my husband.  The service with Courtney was OUTSTANDING!!  I will definitely return, maybe even tonight!  We had a Modelo, Pork & Steak tacos, and Cheviche.  So delicious and a good deal, if you love tacos, come for Taco Tuesday, the deal is even better with 3 tacos for 5 bucks.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche!!!

fLDsAOBKXF_J3EC9xORTFQ.text: This is located just a block away from Freemont street, but seems a bit quieter -- at least on a Sunday afternoon. However, the service leaves much to be desired...We sat at the bar and had chips, salsa, guac and margaritas. It took FOREVER for EVERYTHING! It took a while for us to even get menus, then for the bar tender to take our order, and then the bartender forgot our drinks order, so we had to ask someone else, and then the bartender didn't put in our whole order (even though we only ordered 2 things), so they we had to wait for them to bring out the salsa... The salsa was mediocre and the guac was underwhelmingly plain. The chips were actually pretty good. The margaritas were also mediocre.  And then we had to go through this cycle again of trying to find someone to give us the check. We were going to pay with credit card, but it took so long that we ended up just paying with cash and leaving.  Ambiance-wise, this seemed like a pretty mediocre Tex-Mex/Americanized Mexican joint. Also, they had some interesting choices for their TVs surrounding the bars. One had infomercials, just infomercials: vitamin supplements, prostate issues. Another TV had cartoons. If you're going to make your customers wait indefinitely, at least put something interesting on TV to keep them entertained.

S9whJZhpifbRkzSuQEmZHQ.text: Enchilada nachos were bawm, A+, just Prefer their red sauce over the green. Our server was awesome too thanks guys!

VP8oUzUgFiRXxmukIugpUA.text: I'm a happy customer!! Ariel is a wonderful server!! Trevor is great too, so nice and helpful. Both are so hot too!! Love the tattoos they both have!! I had a great time and will highly recommend!!!

BLtO4LOmc4Zf5sDnnrMvJg.text: A friend was celebrating her birthday and chose this new Nacho Daddy location for dinner. I was so excited because I had been to the location in Henderson and always had good food andxservice.  I was a little disappointed as the downtown location is much smaller and the decor is super urban. There is a small seating area of 2-4 person tables (about 10) and a wall that seperates the bar area with counter height seating. It fits the downtown scene but I don't find that seperation comfortable.   The menu is not the same as what's online or what is at the Henderson location. This menu has less items which was disappointing because I was raving to all of my friends about their delicious quesadillas and it wasn't there. We were also told by the staff that there were items available at the bar were not available on the menu. In the end we got our quesadillas but it was confusing.   Our party was about 13 people and the servers were very good at getting our food and drinks without too long of a wait. I had the burger nachos which was delicious and a raspberry margarita which was a little too sweet but good. My boyfriend had steak fajitas and a skinny margarita and was very satisfied. We ordered the smore's nachos for dessert and that was epic! I recommend it to anyone who loves marshmallows and chocolate.   It was a really good meal and I would go again now that I know what to expect.

x7wcJF0I-q24fLsYFTbDcg.text: Very tasty food.    I like to TASTE my food, not suffer for it, so if you want to know if it was spicy, not very. You can certainly have it be very spicy, but that is not my thing.  We went for an early dinner, so it wasn't crowded, but it did start to fill up by the time we left, mostly around the bar.  I had trio ground beef enchilada plate with rice and beans. The meat was good, no gristle and very flavorful without being greasy. There happened to be a photo of this in the menu, and for once it was an exact representation of what I got!  Overall it was a very tasty meal.    The menu is large and varied for a Mexican place, and if you like Tequila you should come take a look at their liquor menu.  I would definitely go back.

kfjPfVkAtCadrCUmAnllFw.text: I ended up eating way too much here, but it was super worth it. Hearty vegan menu, despite being the processed chik'n stuff (well cooked and seasoned though). I enjoyed it highly.

9JemjH6amxccV8tQGSiGSA.text: Horrible staff. Wouldn't sit me last two times just because it was me, I was literally looking at tables and no one else was in line. I also sat for 20 mins one time by myself waiting for a drink order but they had forgotten ab me outside I had to leave I had gotten so hungry.

gRWimOhBCJpnqenZ_2l88Q.text: Great food great service by Brittany and nice size food portions. The workers are very friendly and helpful they my family and I feel welcome.

H7DL05k1t-07YTulV8Xo0w.text: Ordered a Nacho Average Burger Nacho to go.  When I got back to my hotel room, the nachos didn't have the ground beef. How do you omit a main ingredient from your nachos?  I will never eat here again.  It was late and the choices were limited.  I would have rather had McDonalds.

UFef17QQwll-SgFN7hmgUA.text: Shit is fire. Best margaritas in the city. If you like margaritas you NEED to come here!!

wB7k0GTYWHJtglLmWKsFHw.text: Had the shrimp tacos and was happy with the food. The condiments with the tacos where good too. Wife had the lobster and crab enchiladas. Those where food too. Would go back again. We should up and we're happy to find out kids eat free in Monday.

s8j8R2Z0l6qPkUGQUHYOIA.text: Service was kind of a nightmare. What restaurant tells customers it's a 60 minute wait when there are open tables? On a holiday weekend there's no way you're understaffed. But the vegan nachos were quite good, including house made vegan queso. Try it, just make a reservation and expect it take a while.

8UjX5YrN3XfTDyVQmhnjlg.text: Food is incredible and so are the margaritas. Thank you Jon and Mikey for an awesome experience.

zOF4_i1P6jPA_nxST4kegA.text: Came into nacho daddy on a fly today with two of my friends cause we wanted to grub on some Mexican. Sat at the bar. Our bartender was named Zulma. She was really friendly and actually pleasant to talk to. Refreshing for a Fremont bartender. Food was solid we had the enchiladas and queso. Couple of bloody Mary's which were surprisingly good and they had bacon in it which is always great! Their coffees are good just wouldn't recommend the Mexican latte. Overall experience was good. If you want a margarita or a relaxed atmosphere. Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody

1PcAQ4-1sPdNK0I6wmE7zg.text: Would definitely recommend! Service was good, prices were very reasonable, the nachos and rice bowl were delicious and the house margaritas were fantastic! Make sure you get one! They are strong and so good. This place is such a nice break from the typical scene on the strip. A community oriented company as well, which was a nice plus for us.

uLcazavvgcfPpvo_TNGSRg.text: Well I wouldn't recommend getting your free margarita here. I received my drink and it tasted like only sweet and sour mix asked my server to take it back and he brought me back the same drink that wasn't even remade and it tasted like they didn't add anything to it... He came back to check on us and asked how the drink was and I said it was no better and he didn't try to even fix the problem just said "oh sorry"... pretty bad customer service. Luckily it wasn't a drink I paid for so I didn't proceed to order another. Won't be returning.

vtMWa89eFRZkzNrBAQbBmw.text: Nice little place has great nachos and service that goes right along with it.  Our server was prompt in taking our order and she even gave a great drink recemdation the berry mojito. You have t o try this place if you are ever in Vegas. Oh and they don't try to hurt your pocket with the prices.

4iwc9oRD0V5gO3nIsIc_wQ.text: The nacho selection did not impress me I like real cheese on my nachos bummer.   I ordered the chips and salsa, chips were bathed in salt and only one salsa was tasty. I went for the burger as my entree which was actually pretty good.

WB396gHKno89pxvaOb3llA.text: My husband and I used to frequent the Henderson location and loved it. We would take friends and family when they were in town so when a new one opened up, we were excited. The environment was nice, different from the Henderson location but that's expected because this is more of a bar theme.  The service was ok. They were really friendly but it took a long time for us to get our food. 45 minutes to an hour which is quite long.   I got chicken enchiladas which I typically get at the Henderson location but they were not good. The tortilla was too thick, the chicken wasn't even shredded, more of chunks and the flavor tasted like it came from a can. The rice was hard and nothing to be desired.   Chips were good but you can't really mess that up. Waiting for our check took a while too. Clearly we were ready to go and our waiter walked passed us multiple times without a check in his hand. Finally after bringing it by it took another 10 minutes for him to come get it and the card to pay, despite 1/3 of our party standing up.  Many groups came, ate and left while we were still waiting for our food. We had 3 people in our group so our order was not large.   I won't be back to this location and probably will skip on the other location too.

zmnyGlrb7a6uaK6QXs48rg.text: Customer service not too good. One girl was rude and attitude showed. I wanted to leave but the nachos we ordered we're good. :) things eventually got better. Nice environment. Maybe I'll try again another time.

N9g_tp2j1IO7d8oC8Oa67A.text: This place has a pretty good selection of vegan options on the menu and the vegan nachos are the best. Service was decent and the food was made fast. Only reason it gets 4 stars is I wish there were vegan desserts lol. But overall a great place for locals as well as tourists.

RBURBAowpJlyzZEmDt8vsQ.text: We ended up at Nacho Daddy because the original restaurant we wanted to go to was closed, but we were pleasantly surprised by the food! The portions are massive and the food is indulgent. This was great for my friends, but not me initially because I wanted something healthier to eat. I ordered an egg white omelet with avocado and hash browns, which turned out to be enormous! It was delicious, but a little greasy from the grilled veggies that were inside it. I ate half of it and was stuffed. They were kind enough to bring out free dessert for my friend's birthday! The Fried Ice Cream was SO GOOD! It was my first time having fried ice cream and I really enjoyed it. The real star was the cinnamon covered corn flakes that came with it. I would recommend ordering their nachos since they look amazing and you won't find anything relatively healthy here. Great place if you're looking for food late at night.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep Fried Ice Cream
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg White Omelette and Hash Browns

m3iN0AFCDZ7CGlu1GC4y3g.text: Just left .....it wasn't busy AT ALL and couldn't get the bartender or waitress to serve us.   This is the waitress's staring at their cell phones....18 minutes later we left! Nacho Daddy?? Nacho Nothing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Staring at cellphones-Couldn&#39;t get served!

briF9_F4mNM200MmUPEK0g.text: Wow! Excellent service, excellent food, great atmosphere! What a nice place to dine in with friends and family.   I ordered a Jalapeno Cucumber margarita, when you check-in with Yelp and order an entree you get 1 free margarita. The coupon is good for $8.95, but I asked the server and he recommended this drink. It was $12.95, but they apply the coupon off so I only paid $4, and it was well worth it. It was not a stingy portion, and it was not watered down tequila. It was so good!   Everything we ordered tasted so good, everyone was friendly, just all around good vibes. We parked in the garage right around the corner for $4, so that was also nice that there was ample parking. We didn't have to wait for a table, and we didn't see any homeless/weirdos hanging around outside.   Downtown Las Vegas is overall very dirty as a whole, but this place didn't feel as a part of that. I think they work their location as best as they possibly can.   We will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño Cucumber Margarita
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature Soft Tacos
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole &amp; Chips

tySm5OlLNgTb9gn6_R0l6Q.text: This review is primarily intended for management and ownership.  On Friday, May 24th I was treated in the most appalling, callous and disrespectful way I have ever been treated in my life.  It started at about 45 minutes after I placed an order at the bar.  I started to notice other people's food coming out that sat down after our group.  I politely asked the bartender/server to check on our food.  One person in our group received her food - chicken nachos.  After another 15 minutes or so passed by, I told her that I wanted to take my food to go.  At this point, it became obvious that she forgot to put our order in all together and she started to become aggressive and rude.    It is not in my nature to be rude to waitstaff.  After more debate the someone from management came out.  I'm told them I would pay for my margarita but didn't want to wait any longer for the food.    I'm frustrated by this point but it's not the end of the world.  Then everything took the worse turn possible.  In an effort to cover her own error for failing to put in our order, she proceeds to tell her manager that I "verbally assaulted her and cussed her out".  This was beyond a False accusation as I never even raised my voice.  I did show some frustration which was more than warranted in response to her rude behavior toward us.    Now that I've been labeled an abusive customer I essentially have zero recourse.  The manager isn't getting to the bottom of it.    Now my friend whose nachos were delivered attempts to settle up her bill.  At this point it is discovered that she was provided the order of the couple seated next to us who ordered the exact same thing.  My friend is then accused of knowingly eating the other couples food by the angry, out of line bartender/server.  As if she is supposed to know the order she was given was intended for someone else.    All in all, it was the most ridiculous and disastrous situation I have ever encountered at a restaurant.  I encourage anyone who reads this to read my other reviews as they will see that I am a balanced and fair person.  This is the only one star review I have ever given.  You just don't Falsely accuse your customers of verbal assault.    Lastly, I want to add that I have come to Nacho Daddy once every year for the last five years during the Punk Rock Bowling festival.  It's a tight nit community and I will be sharing this review widely.  Again, I have never been treated this way and I am pretty upset about the whole thing.

Rkl-BKH9NTzUUhIM7FK87w.text: Great place to eat lunch with friends. Environment is awesome I like it highly recommend it.

xCu4dCGakyUKa7k8jJ6YtA.text: I've had Nacho Daddy bookmarked for quite some time and was excited to see that they were open for breakfast.  When we first walked up, it looked like they may have been closed and that Yelp had the hours wrong, but we tried the door and sure enough, they were open.  Yay!  And we were the only customers there...double yay!    Phara was behind the counter and told us that we could sit wherever we liked.  She then took care of us for our entire visit.  She was great!  I knew before going in that I wanted a breakfast taco, so that's what I ordered and it came with rice, beans, and fresh salsa.  Let me say, this plate was amazing!  The fresh crispy flour tortilla was to die for and the taco was so big that there was no picking it up.  I had to eat it with a fork.  So so good!  My daughter ordered the bacon and cheese enchilada with scrambled eggs.  She loved her meal just as much, even saying that it might be the best enchilada she's ever had.  Overall, this was a great experience.  Service and food were both excellent.  The amount of food served was great for the price.  And they have an extensive menu with several versions of nachos that I hope I'm able to return and try one day.  Definitely check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and Cheese Enchiladas
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Taco...so good!
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IzjUSHnPbn4cWEPoa2VW7g.text: Ah...I am a sucker for a good pun and free drinks, and I was able to kill two birds with one stone at Nacho Daddy. It's nacho average brunch destination, but I'll be darned, I ended up eating a plate of freaking nachos for breakfast. Shh...I can eat like trash if I'm on vacation.  ** Don't forget to check in for a free house margarita! It was damn good! **  = L O C A T I O N = It's at the fringe of Fremont Street, and the sign definitely caught my eye as we walked towards Fremont. Nacho Daddy? We'll see about that. Definitely no convenient parking nearby, so you'll have to fend for street parking or pay for a garage. Inside, it's a cool modern feel with a lot of exposed brick.   = F O O D = Lots of Tex-Mex flair going on here; obviously not authentic Mexican cuisine if that's what you're looking for. I had to go for a nacho plate!   + MOCO LOCO NACHO ($12.95): A Loco Moco in nacho form! As advertised, there was hardly a dry nacho on the plate, with enough gravy and cheese to cover every chip. Honestly I don't really crave or think of nachos as an item I frequently want to eat, but they were pretty good for nachos.  = D R I N K S = + HOUSE MARGARITA (free): For a free drink, they made it tasty and strong! A one shot wonder like me doesn't need much to get me going.   + MICHELADA: Whew! This was huge and damn good.   A note: they serve the infamous scorpion tequila shots! They're $20, so I decided to pass, but that would probably be fun for a special occasion or dare.  ==== Food: 4 // Service: 5 // Environment: 4 // Price: 3

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moco Loco nacho ($12.95)
Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary marg

-zU8UmsSSwGoDvEmrcAlWw.text: This is the one spot where you can take all of your friends who are visiting Vegas and they'll all enjoy!   I have tried practically most spots in Vegas and this is the one spot that will never let you down!   FOOD   They have foods for any type of dietary requirements you may have as well. Vegan, Paleo, Gluten Free... you name it, and they're all delicious!  This is where they really shine, where it truly matters.   SERVICE  The service here can get a little annoying at times, for some reason they tend to hire some bartenders/waitresses that have some attitude, and don't really do their job correctly. But the food makes up for it.   COST   It is rather pricey for mexican food I suppose (Around $20 /entree) but you will feel satisfied. Again, when I go here i'm thinking in terms of the food quality, so it is a good value for the money, even if you're paying more than at most places.   AMBIANCE   It gets VERY loud, while I don't like loud places, it doesn't take away from anything to be honest, after all, it's right off Fremont Experience so you can't really expect a quiet place. But I suppose it could be concerning to some people.   Bonus:  They're open late which is another huge plus since after some hours it feels like there arent any good spots open in town.   Guaranteed place for every type of person for sure!

yEVO_xklQwgyq2tVxoUkAQ.text: Last night we needed a late night meal and Nacho Daddy was open until 2:00 a.m. which was perfect since most other places were closed. Once we entered we were promptly seated and our drink orders were taken. Deciding what to order was hard because they had so many vegetarian options which is not usually the case! I was ecstatic to see so many options. I went with the avocado tacos and was not disappointed. They were delicious and I felt full and satisfied. I look forward to coming back and trying some of their other veggie options!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Crispy Avocado Street Taco

wsSPR1Fg-rOcrSQKmdGscA.text: I haven't been here in awhile, good to know that the quality of food is still A+.  Why the 4STAR, prices of drinks are up there, considering that we are downtown, there are places down there where you can get drinks (yes, DRINKS plural) for the price of 1 drink.  However you buy it because it is apart of the experience, c'mon you have to buy at least 1 margarita.   This time around we ordered the filet mignon nachos, kale salad and a steak bowl.  It was all good, mixed the nacho w/ the salad, Yes PLEASE.  Nachos -steak tendered, well seasoned and lots of it.  Piled high, oowee gooey cheesey goodness.  Beans, pico de gallo, guac, sour cream and house made chips, even with all the toppings the chips still had crunch to them.   Kale Salad -chopped style, carrot, cucumber, corn, grape tomatoes, mushrooms, red onions and avocado w/ grilled shrimp.  The presentation was beautiful, I didn't think of taking a pic until after I mixed everything. Fresh greens, crispy veggies, sweet, tangy, savory...add chalula for a kick of heat.  I'm telling you, now stack your fork such as: salad, try to get as much of the veggies as you can w/o overloading you fork + shrimp + 1 nacho chip loaded w/ all the fixings. YUM!  Pair it with a Daddy's Margarita and you are set for some good eating.   The location is super accessible, right down the street from White Castle.  Outside/Indoor seating, place was pretty packed the night we went.  Service fast and our server was AWESOME!  Yes, I can see myself going back w/ some friends to hang out.    ..but this is just my opinion, check it out for yourself.  It's the Downtown location, you can't go wrong.  It's the perfect set up for a night of partying, get the conversation going, a shot, a drink, some good eats and then good bar hop on Fremont East.

l3CTws-JdQyMAW3n4lj-aA.text: Of course I had to check my Yelp Bookmark to see what I had on the list of To Do's...and lord behold look what I Yelped. If I recall correctly, I think I found this place on one of those eat shows! :-) Alright, so my old school mate friend & I hit this up! She said she had heard of it but, never had a chance to go so she was all in and as excited as me to get our Blaxican girl palate fulfilled. Sweet deets Indeed!!!!  This I would say, is the better location out of the 2(other closer to Las Vegas strip) but, the ratings on this are legit. I can solidify this now as this is steps from the "new Downtown street-front nicely decorated boardwalk look"!  Don't forget to use your Yelp Check in for a FREE House Margarita as this is sincerely "the best house margarita I've ever had in Vegas"!!!! It was so good I think we had 2more and was buzz.   Customer service was attentive, offered recommendations and all together on point.  Food...omg they damn supreme nacho's was the **it! This will be my spot from now on everytime I'm in Vegas as I've been craving Nacho Daddy Nachos & that yummy wet burrito every since...  I'm actually jealous that, my girl stay in Vegas and went back the very next night w/her dude. :-0 and has daily access to this spot unlike myself. :-( being miles away.  She's went 3 times in just a week, since her 1st visit with me. You already know...she's on my **it-List because, she been more times than me now & WITHOUT ME! This is just not right! Laughing out loud   PSA: @Nacho Daddy please open up a location in Atlanta, GA. Atlantic Station, Downtown ATL, On Edgewood, Cucumber-land Mall area would be a great place to look into. Please please please come to Atlanta.

3eS7_1Mw7xcDSJG64A5isg.text: I love this location! I have been here many times and the staff is always friendly and attentive.  Today Dean made us the best margaritas.  I personally really enjoy the enchilada nacho's ! To mix it up I ordered half red sauce and half green sauce :)

WtGb_CziF7O8Rz8mxuzwJQ.text: So our first time at Nacho Daddy was a couple days ago on our first night in Vegas, but I was way too fucked up to really eat. Our friends ended up ordering two nachos, the crab and lobster and filet mignon nachos. Once we got back to our Airbnb I sobered a little more and got to try a little bit of their nachos and OH MY GOD best nachos ever. I'm not really a big fan of nachos, but DAMN their nachos are literally the best nachos I have ever had! Yes, they are on the pricier side for nachos, but they're so worth it!!   Fast forward to tonight. While we were walking around downtown Las Vegas, a few of our friends got hungry and had no idea where to eat. We saw Nacho Daddy and decided to go there to eat since we remembered that the nachos were amazing. There was no wait and our group of 11 got seated immediately. Jose was our server and he was excellent. We got the same thing and ordered two orders of the crab and lobster and two of the filet mignon nachos. Our friends we brought there for the first time also agreed that they weren't too huge of fans of nachos until they tried these. We demolished those nachos and didn't leave a single chip behind. I'm just sad that nachos won't be the same to me after having them from here.

NOUO8kXJzH1ODnoN42sRKg.text: Julian & Rico were great and made our Vegas experience even more special! I had 2 Japanese friends visiting Vegas for the first time with me as well as two other friends who happened to be in Vegas the same time we were. We wanted someone to have drinks and an appetizer while in Downtown Vegas and we were so happy that this place was open and still accepted us! Julian & Rico took great care of us the entire time we were there (even though there wasn't anyone else inside the restaurant) and brought out our order of wings and tequila shots always in a timely manner! We had an incredible time here, and were happy with our choice to walk in here. The wings were delicious by the way! Thank you again!!!

GWOAeGjA-LEzAYi0n6U3qw.text: I was staying on Fremont alone solely for the vegan food and booze. I didn't only bar hop...I appetizer hopped. I had a method to my madness though: it had to be on happy hour or have a yelp check-in free drink.   And free drink they did. I got the house margarita with my check in offer and the vegan quesadilla. When I ordered I was surprised to hear a fellow next to me say, "I'll have what she's having." To which the bartender said, "you know she got the vegan quesadilla right?"   *cue 30 minute conversation about every Netflix health documentary*  We both enjoyed our quesadillas and margaritas. As the drinks flowed, the less processed/fake it tasted. By my second strong margarita, I was convinced.   Would I recommend making your farm-raised cheese loving grandma try the vegan food here? No, it's not that convincing. But to be drunk and able to indulge in vegan Mexican food is one of my highlights of 2017. Fortunately grandma can order off of the regular non-vegan/vegetarian menu.

UCKosWysQ81QOCTfegYi4A.text: Let me begin by saying I wanted to love this place! I mean you had me at filet mignon nachos, but the setvice and attitude are horrible! They messed up my nachos, and brought me golden knight ones...ok no biggie. They charged us for both nachos even though we only ordered 1! So he took $25 off when in reality 19.95 of it was food we NEVER even ordered! It took 15 minutes while I watched everyone else eat, then I was given shredded beef caliber for what was supposed to be filet mignon.  It also took almost 35 minutes from the time we ordered to even get our food! I ordered a margarita, and took one sip to see a fly literally swimming around! I finally flagged a staff member down after our bar tender dissapeared with my friends $8 in change (later returning with McDonalds) to complain. He was the only one that wasn't horrible. The bald manager with a goatee came back with a horrible attitude yelling at us because we didn't seek him out right away for their screw up! He told us that he couldn't do anything because he was already in trouble for giving too many comps. Well dude that means you suck as a manager. He kept saying he was a blunt person, and that we must basically suck as customers, and to call the gm Jeff or James (can't remember the name as I was so pissed) the next day if we had such a problem with how we were treated. Mind you my 2 friends he treated so bad are both in strip hospitality that send customers there regularly, and now will stop, and let customers know how bad it is! He finally took the drink off our friends tab that they never ordered and $25 off our even tho the drink was full and the food was all left we well, as a local I will steer far from this place, and tell all visiting friends to do the same! My husband works sales on the strip and will also steer clients elsewhere for lunch as well! They also had a whole section closed down and made people wait so long they left. I'm honestly perplexed as to how this place has 4 stars with how crappy they treat customers!

dhYhALtSEcPTm36SA8AHlA.text: So we ate at Nacho Daddy and the non-vegan options were great. My son, who has a dairy allergy, was so happy to have vegan options for nachos. "Mom they have vegan queso!" He ordered one of the vegan nachos and had an allergic reaction. We were assured that it was all vegan but he reacted so it cannot be vegan.

t0pi-pHmVcTlrUD8SEkxUg.text: Love this place! It was a girls night out and our first time at this location. Rico was super helpful with the menu and very attentive throughout the entire meal! Margaritas were delicious, food was hot and tasty, and service was on point! I like that it's right next to Fremont, so we walked around while waiting for our table until they texted us. We will definitely be back!

8efgVoJtmmYXhX2IwgQuxA.text: Well, we had to hit this place because of the name and of course Nachos! Service was quick and the staff was great. They do have a little disclaimer that there is no dry chip, but we found many. I mentioned it to the waiter who then told the manager who came out. I wasn't upset I just was surprised they had the disclaimer. However the manager didn't seem to take it all that serious and offered something to dip the chis in which I declined. I just surprised they put that on their menu then react the way they did when someone actually brings it to their attention. It wasn't busy at the time. That is the reason for not 5 stars.

Y270jckVHnXnyvPYgbfVXQ.text: Had the Enchilada Nachos with green sauce, so GOOD. Decided to use the free house margarita from yelp and man it was strong! Experienced great food and excellent service. VSK8QyYfn2wXyG7z4evM0w.text: Soooooooooo good!!! They had vegan options which was amazing! Ugh I wanna go back when I visit again.

i54DtKlWB4X5dGvDka8KRw.text: Let's start w/ this is a little delay, June 2017 I was downtown w/ my little brother. Him and his girlfriend were hungry, and I could have waited to leave the tourist area, but they could not.  We while walking they said Nacho Daddy, I was like Okay, I won't be eating anyone.  SItting there outside, I decided to look at the menu. let me add I was never at a nacho daddy before. I saw they had an American breakfast. I thought myself, they can not mess that up. Well, the server, who I apology I can not remember his name, came over, provided us w/ our drinks, I ordered my food along with everyone else.  When the food came out, which was on average for an eatery in Vegas, I had so much breakfast food I almost could not finish it.  Between the more than average Bacon, and eggs to the hashbrowns.  And the price was average for off the strip prices.  As this was an unexpected trip to a restraunt, it was well worth it and I will be back anytime I go down town.   Lets add my brother and his girl, ordered the normal Nacho Daddy stuff, and they loved it too..

BS4GQqvBEIel4fwOoWgoPQ.text: RICO and his scorpion shots are a must !!!! Hands  down best waitress ! Super nice ! And great service ! The tacos are a must ! Remember to take your scorpion shot before your meal ! Go big or go home ! Chew that scorpion !  , shrimp tacos  are just delicious and don't forget to check in on your yelp and get your free margarita . I will definitely recommend nacho daddy ! Friday's are a must !

_EPIy54K5se288OO896Abw.text: Great fun place to eat. Our waitress Perla was wonderful!  Highly recommend when in Vegas!

1XSVet2N4ShQOyeVEk1q_A.text: Love their white peach margarita! We come pretty often whether it be for dine in or take out! Thai chicken nachos are the best and the chips and salsa are delicious too!

5Knl3F1Aa4UDWJQYASXzvA.text: Always stop at Nacho Daddy's when we come to Las Vegas and today was no exception. We went today (Friday) at around 3:44 pm. Always enjoy the food and service at this downtown location but today was a different story! The hostess was so rude and had a serious attitude (young African American with dreadlocks). We waited for a bit when she approached us and my friend asked if we can sit any where....her attitude was so unnecessary as she said "nope do you want a table or the bar." It's not what she said, it is how she said it. We opted for the table and the attitude continued as she put the menus on our table.  We decided to leave because she made us so uncomfortable....moved on over to Triple George Grill (my next review :-) I'm sorry I cannot rate the food this time but to me, food doesn't matter if the experience sucks.  What is happening to the service?!!!!  Nacho Daddy is definitely known for their amazing nachos but when visiting Vegas, we ALWAYS make a stop here...me for the vegetarian crispy street tacos (deep fried avocado tacos). My dad loves the fish tacos...check out this fish taco! We have tried a variety of things on the menu including the vegan nachos....every time We come, we are all happy with our meal. They have it all...breakfast, lunch and dinner and anything you try, is good! Makes this vegetarian happy! They have meals for vegans and of course, lots for the carnivores! And I cannot forget the bar...it has a good variety of spirits. Service is always good. We usually go on a Friday or Saturday by 6:00 pm to beat the crowd! Nacho Daddy is a must try when you are in Las Veg

uiZoyKCEOTNjzyrqZ3ABsw.text: Disappointed! I've had nacho daddy in my bookmarks for a while now & this location let me down. Service was horrible. Host sat my friend & I at a table and it took about 5 minutes to get any service. There were 3 servers just standing around not doing anything until we called one over. The waiter Jon was rude & everything we ordered he kept clarifying the prices.
